neighborhood_overview:
Our House is located in the Liberty State Park neighborhood and you are invited to enjoy the private large two bedrooms apartment on second floor .The kitchen is completely new and is fully supplied with dishes and cookware, and has a gas range, stainless steel refrigerator, granite counter top, microwave and dishwasher. Fresh bedding linens and towels are included.

There is also free street parking for those with a car.

Location is great. Just 25 - 40 minutes by convenient public transportation to Manhattan and just 10 minutes by car. Walking distance to Liberty State Park with beautiful views of Manhattan, there is recreation area, jogging paths, playground, barbecue areas, Science Museum and the ferry to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty.

Full disclosure - professional photographs make my place look larger and brighter!

Downtown Jersey City, two blocks to the PATH train.

First floor room w/ queen size bed, private bathroom, and access to the backyard. I live on the 2nd and 3rd floor.

Amenities outside the bedroom: small table and chairs, desk and office chair, microwave, toaster oven, mini fridge, electric kettle, utensils, utility sink for washing dishes. No access to upstairs or full kitchen.
view:
Room & Private Bath~Minutes to NYC!Full disclosure - professional photographs make my place look larger and brighter!

Downtown Jersey City, two blocks to the PATH train.

First floor room w/ queen size bed, private bathroom, and access to the backyard. I live on the 2nd and 3rd floor.

Amenities outside the bedroom: small table and chairs, desk and office chair, microwave, toaster oven, mini fridge, electric kettle, utensils, utility sink for washing dishes. No access to upstairs or full kitchen.
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is right outside of Manhattan, and has great restaurants, bars, and shops all within walking distance. There are parks nearby as well. If you walk 10 minutes to the waterfront you will get spectacular views of Manhattan. A large shopping mall and grocery store are also a couple blocks away. I have lived here over 15 years and feel very safe.

Other local attractions include Hoboken and Liberty State Park which has ferry service to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and Manhattan.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is seconds from "Little India", which offers low-budget to formal Indian dining, in addition to Filipino, Latin American, and Egyptian cuisine, reflecting the city's wide ethnic population. Downtown Jersey City is also minutes away and offers a big variety of Bars and Restaurants.

Jersey City is just across the Hudson river, and it's closer and better connected to the heart of Manhattan than some boroughs and locations in New York City. It is literally 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan by subway (path train) and 15mn away from Greenwich Village and midtown. The Path Train runs all day and all night on a schedule.

description:
One-bedroom apartment in the heart of downtown Jersey City. Located very conveniently to commute or travel to Manhattan and to arrive, door to door, in less than 30 minutes to most of the relevant places in NY, such as Wall Street, Greenwich Village, or Penn Station in Midtown.


Enjoy this one bedroom apartment, that accommodates 4 people, and its completely new furniture. It also includes wifi, TV with Netflix, and a large kitchen with all appliances including dishwasher.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. Itâ€™s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. If you want more shopping, next to the Newport Mall, you can find Shoprite, BJâ€™S Wholesale, Bed Bath & Beyond, The Home Depot and Target.

STR22-116
view:
Nice Apt -10 minutes to ManhattanLarge apartment in Downtown Jersey City, steps from the Grove street Path station, less than 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan (World Trade Center.)

STR22-116
neighborhood_overview:
Mercer Street is in the heart of Historic Downtown/Van Vorst areas of Jersey City anchored by the Grove Street PATH station. When not exploring Manhattan, there is much to do in Jersey City. These include:
* walking along the Hudson River Waterfront for great views of Manhattan or venturing over to Hoboken for the great bar scene
* checking out the great restaurants in the area
* visiting massive Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty
* taking the kids to the Liberty Science Center
* attending the Farmers' Market or the live music performances at Grove Square: http://www.jcdowntown.org/
* shopping at the Newport Center Mall or the local boutiques scattered on Grove Street or finding a bargain at the flea market on Saturday's at Van Vorst Park

description:
Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:

neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything youâ€™d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, youâ€™ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

After a day at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, a matinee show on Broadway, or a packed agenda of meetings, youâ€™re bound to be hungry, Cook up a storm in the full kitchen, which features stainless steel appliances, including a full-size fridge and freezer, an electric stove, an oven, a microwave, and a dishwashe

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is exploding with new restaurants, high rises, and notoriety ... it is the new hot spot to live in the NYC metro area. You will find one of the best restaurants (Madame Claude's) one block from my place, but there are lots of great bars and restaurants nearby.

RESTAURANTS/BARS:
Madame Claude's - amazing French food, killer brunch, fantastic Parisian music Thursday nights ... get a reservation. (1 min. walk)
Cellar 335 - very cool spot, global eats, tiki themed (1 min)
White Star - local dive bar w/solid food (3 min.)
Porta - great pizza (10 min.)
Taqueria - best Mexican food around, great fish/pork tacos (13 min.)
Talde - pricey, but memorable (10 min.)
Mathews - upscale, menu for everyone (12 min.)
Ibby's Falafel - great falafel sandwich (14 min.)
Pet Shop - used to be local pet shop, now it's a bar (8 min.)
Dullboy - cocktail lounge hip w/NYC vibe (12 min.)
BeClaws - if you want seafood (7 min

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is enchanting newcomers for its charm, strong sense of community and thriving local business scene.

The Heights overlooks Hoboken from the Palisades, and because Hoboken is a historic district with height restrictions there are no high rises affording the Heights protected NYC views. Central Avenue and Palisade Avenue boast immaculate Manhattan skyline and Hudson River vistas.

Jersey City Heights retains the feeling of a small town and is very walkable. I would describe the Heights as youthful, energetic and extremely diverse.

neighborhood_overview:
It is one mile from the Journal Square transportation center (JSQ on the PATH line). From JSQ, you can take the PATH to Newark and catch the NJ Transit trains. You can also go to Hoboken, World Trade Center or take the 33rd Street line to Greenwich Village or uptown. It takes less than one hour to get to 33rd St via PATH. There is a bus stop right on the corner about 100 feet away. From there, you can get the bus to JSQ or directly into Port Authority in NYC, which puts you right near Times Square and the theater district. The bus to Port Authority usually takes 45-60 minutes. We are one block from Lincoln Park, which offers great walks and opportunities to work out, including jogging paths and a track.
We are 5 blocks from St. Peter's University, 1.5 miles to NJCU and a mile from Hudson County Community College.
We are also very close to Liberty State Park, which is one of the most visited state parks in the country! You can get a ferry to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Is

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and trendy. Itâ€™s a great neighborhood for New York City commuters and travelers as well as for those that want to enjoy a bit more calmness than Manhattan while being minutes away from it.

Aside from the proximity to the underground transportation with Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey, you will have in less than 5 minutes walk a large diversity of exciting cafes, restaurants, bars, shops, yoga studios, gyms and a great supermarket (Keyfood).

In less than 15 minutes walk you will reach a large shopping mall, a multiplex movie theater, several parks, and the riverside with some of the best views in the New York Metropolitan Area. If you want more shopping, next to the Newport Mall, you can find Shoprite, BJâ€™S Wholesale, Bed Bath & Beyond, The Home Depot and Target.

Enjoy this studio, that accommodates 2 people. It also includes wifi and TV.

Downtown Jersey City's Grove Street area is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood. It is known for its mix of residential, commercial, and entertainment offerings, making it a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

Grove Street serves as the main hub of this neighborhood, lined with a variety of shops, restaurants, cafes, and bars. The area has a lively atmosphere with a diverse array of cuisines, ranging from cozy brunch spots to upscale dining experiences. It's a great place to explore and discover unique flavors from around the world.
One of the key attractions of the Grove Street area is its accessibility, particularly due to the presence of the Grove Street PATH train station. It provides convenient transportation options for residents commuting to Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey. It offers a direct connection to the World Trade Center in Lower Manhattan, making it a popular choice for professionals working in New York City.

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of Jersey City's vibrant Journal Square neighborhood, the property combines urban energy with community charm. This area is renowned for its diverse cultural tapestry, thriving arts scene, and culinary delights, offering residents a lifestyle that blends convenience and character.

Located just a short 12min walk from Journal Square PATH Station, the neighborhood is a commuter's dream, providing seamless access to Manhattan, Newark, and beyond. Strolling through the tree-lined streets, you'll find an eclectic mix of historic brownstones, modern apartment complexes, and inviting green spaces, like nearby Leonard Gordon Park, perfect for relaxation or recreation.

The area pulses with activity, from locally-owned coffee shops and trendy eateries to vibrant markets and boutique stores that reflect the cultural diversity of its residents. For families, schools and community centers are within reach, fostering a warm, inclusive atmosphere.

description:
PROS
Conveniently located to access lower Manhattan and visit the Statute of Liberty
Suitable for people using Newark Airport, driving car, traveling in group or looking for basic accommodation

neighborhood_overview:
- Not a greatest neighborhood in Jersey City. We are one Light Rail stop off from the most developed/expensive part of JC (and the contrast is quite clear). You will notice graffiti as well as bars covering the windows (but the crime rate is not at all high compared to surrounding area including downtown JC based on public statistics). Some of our guests were not comfortable being in the neighborhood and it took for our family to get used to it.
- The neighborhood could be noisy due to freight railway that passes nearby and a neighbor who plays loud music outside every few Saturday.
- Limited supermarkets and restaurants availability (a few small convenient stores in the neighborhood but, for a decent supermaket, you will have to take light rail to Hudson Greene Market near Exchange Place station.)

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City, New Jersey, United States

This city is full of history and quaint restaurants and bars that earned it its nickname as â€œThe Wall Street Westâ€. The historic downtown has many million-dollar brownstones and row houses filled with charming historical 1800â€™s characteristics. Jersey City just recently spent 7 million dollars upgrading its main upscare pedestrian walkway downtown area with all stores and restaurants. A super fast commute to NYC with many restaurants and boutiques: walk to the subway and ride just 5 minutes to NYC World Trade Center.

The house, built in 1856, is located in Downtown Jersey City with a lot to offer: CafÃ©s, Restaurants ( Orale - Mexican cuisine Razza Pizza), Bars (Dullboy, The Ashford), Pharmacies ( CVS, Walgreens, Medly), and just minutes to Hudson River Waterfront Walkway (walk along the water and enjoy stunning views of NYC). Reserve your seat at the Wally Wall, Manhattan Yacht Club's floating clubhouse in the harbor.

description: A lovely one-bedroom apartment located in the tree lined historic 'Doctor's Row' neighborhood. It is adjacent to Lincoln Park with a Citi Bike station nearby. There is easy access to Manhattan via the Journal Square PATH station. This flat is quiet, sunny, and has a private entrance. Has elegant bathroom and fully equipped kitchen. The bedroom was upgraded with a brand new luxury mattress as of April 2023.

neighborhood_overview:
Beautiful Lincoln Park is only a half block away and is part of the newly designated historic district. The park boasts river-front views, a 9-hole golf course, tennis courts, bird sanctuary, and a grand fountain recently restored to its original glory (designed by Pierre J. Cheron, it is the world's largest concrete monument!).
There are many great restaurants in Jersey City, along with farmers' markets and easy access to grocery and other shopping. Restaurant recommendations will be provided on your arrival, along with local transportation info and other helpful tips.

name: Cozy red studio 15 min walk to JSQ path station
description: This spacious studio in on the parlor floor of a brownstone house. It has a high ceiling that gives the feeling of a loft and hardwood floors. The sleeping area has two twin XL beds which can be push together to make a kingsize bed and sitting area has a sofa bed. Sleeping, living and eat-in kitchen areas are all connected. Only the bathroom has a door. Journal Square Path Station  is 15 min walk away when you stay on Summit Ave. and enter the station on the backside on Summit Ave.
view: Cozy red studio 15 min walk to JSQ path stationThis spacious studio in on the parlor floor of a brownstone house. It has a high ceiling that gives the feeling of a loft and hardwood floors. The sleeping area has two twin XL beds which can be push together to make a kingsize bed and sitting area has a sofa bed. Sleeping, living and eat-in kitchen areas are all connected. Only the bathroom has a door. Journal Square Path Station  is 15 min walk away when you stay on Summit Ave. and enter the station on the backside on Summit Ave.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a cosmopolitan neighborhood. The Journal Square Path Station (Jersey City-Hoboken's subway system that connects us to Manhattan) is only 15 min walking distance away. We are very close to downtown Jersey City where you can find fancy restaurants and bars. Hoboken is also close by. Uber and the Citibike are affordable options to go to the Path Station and downtown, even to Hoboken. This studio is close to Manhattan and offers great value for those venturing into the city. If you are from the suburbs or small cities of the US with no traffic, no crowds, be prepared for big city life. Itâ€™s a safe neighborhood. My family and I have lived in this neighborhood for almost two decades. None of my tenants, guests or neighbors have had an issue about safety.
If you want a good value for your money, this is the right place for you!
STREET PARKING: If you are planning to come with a car, you're lucky if you can find a spot on the street. Jersey City is a highly populated city

Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit
Resort-style building amenities such as an outdoor pool, theater room, gym, and 24/7 concierge
Light rail steps from the front door and easy access to PATH
Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

neighborhood_overview:
Why stay in Manhattan when you can savor the peace and quiet of this luxurious Jersey City high-rise? Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything youâ€™d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, youâ€™ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

name: Chic & Modern 1 bedroom, near New York City - NYC
description: Experience our chic garden-level brownstone, just 15 min from NYC by subway/car. This 1bedroom, child friendly, boasts local artwork, exposed brick, contemporary design, Wi-Fi, A/C, 65" TV, Nespresso, workspace and pull out sofa. Enjoy easy access (5 min walk) to the vibrant Pedestrian Plaza featuring restaurants, bars, and nightlife. Hosts are bilingual  (English-French). Infant and toddler accessories available upon request.  Enjoy the Jersey City & NYC lifestyle in style and comfort.
view: Chic & Modern 1 bedroom, near New York City - NYCExperience our chic garden-level brownstone, just 15 min from NYC by subway/car. This 1bedroom, child friendly, boasts local artwork, exposed brick, contemporary design, Wi-Fi, A/C, 65" TV, Nespresso, workspace and pull out sofa. Enjoy easy access (5 min walk) to the vibrant Pedestrian Plaza featuring restaurants, bars, and nightlife. Hosts are bilingual  (English-French). neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in a vibrant Jersey City neighborhood, our chic apartment offers easy access to New York City, just a 15-minute subway ride or car journey away. The lively Pedestrian Plaza, a 5-minute walk, boasts an array of restaurants, bars, nightlife, and shops. Green spaces, a grocery store, and coffee shops are also within 2 minute walking distance. With its unique blend of city life, local charm, historic architecture, and diverse culture, this neighborhood provides the perfect base for exploring Jersey City and NYC, all within walking reach.

neighborhood_overview: People from New York have shown a tendency to move to Jersey City Heights, because it provides all the comfort and accessibility without having to pay the extra fees that comes from living in the big city.  Security video camera so you can feel secure at my property. Street parking requires a daily $5.00 permit from Monday through Friday). Cars are constantly moving around. Watch out for street cleaning signs where you have to move your car to the opposite side of the street. Mondays and Thursdays one side. Tuesdays and Fridays the opposite side. Street is  cleaned from 10-12noon. No street cleaning happens on Wednesdays or weekends. You can buy your parking permit at the parking authority which is two blocks away (open 8:30-5:00pm M-F) you will need a copy of the reservation, car registration and the application form which i left copies in the apartment.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey city has been noted as the most diversely populated city in the country.
It's a busy city but safe, short walk to the path train or bus terminal to take you to NYC in 10 mins. Popular fast food chains available locally, also some excellent independently owned restaurants. Feel free to ask for any suggestions. Newark avenue also known as little India is where you'll be transported into a street in Mumbai and get excellent cuisine. Downtown Jersey city offers some of the best cuisine and dining experiences on the East coast. TimeOut magazine has Ani Ramen, Batello, Dull boy and Hamilton Pork listed as best eats and the list goes on. The waterfront also offers an amazing view of the NYC skyline and additional dining options. With Lady Liberty on your left the ferries going into NYC are also a great sightseeing travel alternative. Liberty Science Center, liberty state park and Ellis island are also minutes away. With NYC as a famous backdrop Jersey City is also a very notable

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of Jersey City's vibrant Journal Square neighborhood, the property combines urban energy with community charm. This area is renowned for its diverse cultural tapestry, thriving arts scene, and culinary delights, offering residents a lifestyle that blends convenience and character.

Located just a short 12min walk from Journal Square PATH Station, the neighborhood is a commuter's dream, providing seamless access to Manhattan, Newark, and beyond. Strolling through the tree-lined streets, you'll find an eclectic mix of historic brownstones, modern apartment complexes, and inviting green spaces, like nearby Leonard Gordon Park, perfect for relaxation or recreation.

The area pulses with activity, from locally-owned coffee shops and trendy eateries to vibrant markets and boutique stores that reflect the cultural diversity of its residents. For families, schools and community centers are within reach, fostering a warm, inclusive atmosphere.

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the HudsJersey City, located directly across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, offers the best of both worlds. Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The historic neighborhood was once the first destination for immigrants entering through Ellis Island and still remains one of the most diverse areas of New Jersey. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.on River from Lower Manhattan, itâ€™s part of the New York metropolitan area. neighborhood_overview:
Great restaurants downtown Jersey City (20 minute walk), cafes and shops are nearby as well. 2 different options for parking: $15/day parking in a driveway near our house or Journal Square Path subway has a big lot, check online for current pricing. Please let us know when booking if you will need parking so we can reserve the driveway for you.

There are also two Citi Bike Stations (Bike sharing program) within 5-7 minutes walk (Jefferson Avenue and Beacon Avenue). Great way to get around and there are stations downtown Jersey City, at Liberty State Park and all over so you can check out everything and not have to worry about parking.

Modern residences across the 300-acre community, which is home to 15,000 people, feature spacious, light-filled apartments with stunning views of the Manhattan skyline. Residences feature open layouts with hardwood floors, oversized windows, 24-hour doorman services, parking and laundry facilities. Several buildings include a variety of amenities including a rooftop lounge, screening room, fitness center, and childrenâ€™s playroom.

Along the waterfront, you will find the communityâ€™s signature waterfront park, featuring the only urban beach on the Hudson River. In the summer, it also hosts events exclusively for residents, including outdoor movie screenings, live concerts and festivals. And also features eight sleek corporate office towers comprising nearly six million square feet of Class A office space.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patt

neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

description: This lovely, quiet and well designed space is a 1 min walk from frequently running buses that will have you in times square in about 25 to 35min depending traffic. There is a liquor/convenience store around the corner. There is a park featuring tennis courts, year round indoor pool, seasonal ice skating rink and Manhattan skyline views, two blocks away. There are a variety of small, lovely restaurants in walking distance. The neighborhood is very quiet comfortable and safe at all hours.

neighborhood_overview:
Historic Downtown Jersey City is brimming with activity! With its close proximity to NYC, the area has seen a rapid development in the past 7 years and is now home to a diverse mix of locals, restaurants, bars and businesses. Just take a look on Yelp and you will find over 50 places to eat and drink at that are rated 4 STARS and above, all within a 10 minute walk from the apartment! In addition, there is Newport Mall nearby, which has a lot of shopping options (H&M, Zara, Coach, G-Star, Macys, Footlocker to name a few) a cinema and a diverse food court.

In our opinion, there are only 3 areas in New Jersey that are worth staying in if you are visiting NYC for a vacation or for business. Downtown Jersey City, Historic Jersey City and Hoboken due to their transport links to Manhattan, great local bars and restaurants, and for being known as incredibly safe areas.

Journal Square is still developing and very rough around the edges, with few bars and restaurants to

Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything youâ€™d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. neighborhood_overview:
Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is becoming a go-to spot for new residents and tourists alike. It was previously an independent municipality that formally became part of Jersey City in 1870. Offering luscious green parks, the Riverview Arts District and bustling thoroughfares dotted with shops and restaurants, itâ€™s clear the Heights is making its name as a premier destination. The house is located on a quiet and safe tree-lined street with direct access to Citi Bike and shopping and restaurants located on Central Avenue.
Jersey City Heights is very diverse neighborhood â€“ Spanish, Italian, Indian, Asian, and many other ethnicities and a variety of food choices. The area has become a destination for young professionals, working in Manhattan and living in Jersey City, NJ. neighborhood_overview:
We live in the Lincoln Park area of Jersey City, in between ST PETER'S UNIVERSITY, And NJCU colleges. We live near West side avenue, and Communipaw avenue.

My part of the block is a little quieter than other parts of the area. Lincoln park is a few blocks away, along with a golf course. If you want to walk or jog in the park, this is a great place to do so. Sundays there is a farmer's market in the park, if you want to check that out.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a gem with the best view of the Manhattan skyline and a 7 min drive to the Statue of Liberty! Hoboken, home of Carlo's Bakery, is our next door neighbor. Our neighborhood is especially family friendly and walkable. Enjoy tennis, picnicking, bike trails and multiple playgrounds, all within a 3-minute walk from your home away from home. Just around the corner is a Catholic church, an array of ethnic eateries, a Dairy Queen, convenience stores, fruitstands, hair salons, etc.

We are also close to Liberty State Park, where you can catch a ferry to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, or to NYC!

name: Stylish Apt 40 mins from NYC - TV/Laundry/Parking
description:
Monthly renters welcome.

Rent this tastefully decorated, sun drenched one bedroom urban apartment 40 minutes away from Manhattan. One parking spot on site. Located near light rail train in the bustling Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City, this unit features a plush queen bed, an extra air mattress, 49" LED TV, WiFi, fully equipped kitchen, walk-in shower, and in-unit laundry. Street parking usually available. You will be steps away from parks and trendy restaurants.
view:
Stylish Apt 40 mins from NYC - TV/Laundry/ParkingMonthly renters welcome.

Rent this tastefully decorated, sun drenched one bedroom urban apartment 40 minutes away from Manhattan. One parking spot on site. Located near light rail train in the bustling Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City, this unit features a plush queen bed, an extra air mattress, 49" LED TV, WiFi, fully equipped kitchen, walk-in shower, and in-unit laundry. Street parking usually available. You will be steps away from parks and trendy restaurants.
neighborhood_overview:
Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Uber is very popular in Jersey City, and a ride between the apartment and the PATH station at Exchange Place in Downtown won't cost more than $10. They will take a group of 4 people, which means your cost per-person will be lower than the $2.5 light rail ticket. If you haven't used Uber before, let me know and I will send you an invite which comes with a small discount.

view:
NEW- Great Private Room Near NYC #3Enjoy the full NYC experience but without the outrageous costs! Path Train 20 min to NY and only a few miles to Newark Int. Airport

Located in the heart of Jersey City, Close to Downtown Manhattan and main public transportation. This comfortable and clean PRIVATE ROOM is mainly created for non-complicated and friendly people. It will be a pleasure to host you!

We Offer: Private Room with a beautiful Mid Century modern QUEEN Size Bed with incredible comfortable mattress. With desk, HD TV.
neighborhood_overview:
Guests will be located close to everything in a very safe neighborhood. The area is very unique where you can encounter very cool findings (Restaurants, coffee shops, vintage stores, etc.) You'll be located two blocks away from the Palisade Ave. & Prospect St. bus stops, where you will be able to easily take buses to many tourists attractions.

The following popular places are VERY accessible (By train, bus, or walking):

- Pershing Field Park (Pool, Tennis, Picnic, 2 Baseball Fields, Jogging Track) *Walking Distance.
- River View Park (Great view and to take pictures of New York) *Walking Distance.
- Loew's Jersey Theater *Walking distance\bus
- Liberty State Park (Here you can see an up close of the Statue of Liberty and\or even take the ferry to the Island itself) *Bus\Train
- Liberty Science Center (Museum) *Bus\train - Same stop as Liberty State Park
- Jersey City Museum (Uber\Bus)
- Museum of Russian Art (Uber\Bus)
- Ellis I

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the historic neighborhood of Hamilton Park in downtown Jersey City. The apartment is two blocks away from the park, which has tennis courts, a basketball court, a large playground, plenty of tree-shaded grassy areas for a picnic, and a farmerâ€™s market on Wednesdays from May through November.

Newark Avenue, a pedestrian-only street with lots of trendy restaurants and bars, is an 8-minute walk away.

The Newport Mall, with plenty of shopping options and a large movie theater, is three blocks away.

There are a number of restaurants, as well as some great ice cream shops and several local coffee shops, within close walking distance. There are also two grocery stores located within five blocks of the apartment (ShopRite and Key Food).

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: Classic 2 Bedroom Apartment in Jersey City Newport
description:
Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
- Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit
- Resort-style building amenities such as an outdoor pool, theater room, gym, and 24/7 concierge
- Light rail steps from the front door and easy access to PATH

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is close to NYC and has a variety of public transportation options. Neighboring Hoboken and downtown Jersey City are both easy 15 minute walks and have plenty of lovely options for dining and entertainment. 20 minutes from Newark airport.

We are 6 miles from MetLife stadium, home to the Giants and Jets. Appr. 15 minutes via Uber or car.

We provide maps and bus/train instructions for NYC travel. The fastest to Herald Square (Macys's) is (a) 16 min walk to PATH at Journal Square, then 20 min train to 33rd street. Or take 3 minute bus to PATH for faster service. PATH drops at Christopher Street, 9th street, 14th street (Union Square), 23rd street and 33rd street (Macy's). There is also a separate Path Service line directly to the World Trade Center (about 10 minutes on the train).

There are also direct buses that get you to Times Square (Port Authority) in about 35 to 45 minutes that pickup directly outside of our street.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very safe and family friendly. Like NYC, the neighborhood is cultural diversity. Jersey City has been gentrifying for the last few years.Â  We have seen an influx of young professionals and families like ourselves move into this beautiful, vibrant city. We have lived in Jersey City for nine years with our three young kids (6,8,10) and Tim's family has been here for 100+ years.

A couple of blocks from us is an elementary school, catholic high school, Saint Peter's University, churches, and the New Jersey National Guard Armory.

There is a grocery store, wine shop, diners/restaurants right around the corner. One of the best bagel places in the NYC/NJ area is just a few blocks away. An amazing local favorite breakfast spot, Cafe Alice is a block from us. Little India, a 15-minute walk away, has some of the best restaurants around and there are plenty of dining options closer to Journal Square.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

Light Rail is 10m walk
This room is located on the ground level of the house

Check out my guidebook for recommendations!
The Journal Square area is old and gaining ground with occasional classic films playing at the historic Loews Theater across from the Path Station.
â€¢The Mana Contemporary Art Center is around the corner.
â€¢Square 1 Community cafe is 2 doors down serving excellent food and coffees, drinks etc.
â€¢Little India is a block away with shopping, fresh food, butchers and excellent restaurants.
â€¢Convenience stores like the Dollar Store, a liquor store and small ethnic markets are easily available. There are ashrams as well and a yoga studio.
â€¢Grove Street (Path station stop) is chock full of new restaurants that are delicious and now pedestrian in some areas. Shops and nightlife abound if you decide to stay in Jersey City. Jivamukti has an excellent yoga studio there as well.
â€¢Exchange Place (Path station) has a direct ferry to Brookside Place (near WTC and the Oculus).

BOOK WITH CONFIDENCE: This airbnb is LEGAL w all permits and inspected by the city for your safety. There are many illegal airbnbs out there donâ€™t let shady hosts ruin your stay. Legal ones have Registration Number with current year on the listing.

neighborhood_overview:
We love our neighborhood for the perfect balance of walkability, diversity, and livability. Smart travelers already know Downtown Jersey City is closer to Manhattan than 95% of Queens and Brooklyn with considerably less crowds. Plus our mayor is young and progressive and fully legalized airbnb in 2015, unlike NYC where is very much illegal for short term rentals. Our waterfront has one of the most picturesque views of lower Manhattan, New York Harbor and Statue of Liberty.

The apartment is two short blocks away from Hamilton Park surrounded by gorgeous brownstones and 19th century rowhouses, and it is adorned with impressive 100+ year old trees and lush glass within that often serve as gathering place for locals and visitors alike - the park hosts weekly farmers market, seasonal movie screenings, barbecue festivals, tennis and basketball courts, just to name a few.

Guests will be located close to everything in a very safe neighborhood. The area is very unique where you can encounter very cool findings (Restaurants, coffee shops, vintage stores, etc.) You'll be located two blocks away from the Palisade Ave. & Prospect St. bus stops, where you will be able to easily take buses to many tourists attractions.

** Visit the "One World Observatory" and get great deals by visiting the following link - (URL HIDDEN) **

The following popular places are VERY accessible (By train, bus, or walking):

- Pershing Field Park (Pool, Tennis, Picnic, 2 Baseball Fields, Jogging Track) *Walking Distance.
- River View Park (Great view and to take pictures of New York) *Walking Distance.
- Loew's Jersey Theater *Walking distance\bus
- Liberty State Park (Here you can see an up close of the Statue of Liberty and\or even take the ferry to the Island itself) *Bus\Train
- Liberty Science Center (Museum) *Bus\train - Same

name: Lovely private bed/bath Paulus Hook, Jersey City
description:
Dear Airbnb Searchers,
We offer self check-in. But ideally I will be here to let you in.

Street parking is pretty easy to find. (I provide visitor permits for $10/day). A visitor permit is needed Mon. - Fri. from 10am - 5pm. On Thursdays you shouldn't park on our side, there will be street cleaning. No permit needed on weekends/holidays.
view:
Lovely private bed/bath Paulus Hook, Jersey CityDear Airbnb Searchers,
We offer self check-in. But ideally I will be here to let you in.

Street parking is pretty easy to find. (I provide visitor permits for $10/day). A visitor permit is needed Mon. - Fri. from 10am - 5pm. On Thursdays you shouldn't park on our side, there will be street cleaning. No permit needed on weekends/holidays.
neighborhood_overview:
We love the Paulus Hook neighborhood. We are five blocks from the Hudson River! The Freedom Tower in lower Manhattan is visible to the east as you stand in front of our house. There are convenient coffee and breakfast places just a couple of blocks away. I highly recommend the Light Horse Tavern, Amelia's, Taqueria, and Sam a.m. (for breakfast), four of many great restaurants within a few blocks of our house.

Practically anything you want is really less than a 15 minute walk away! More excellent restaurants for foodies, specialty grocery stores, bakeries, live music, etc. I'm happy to provide recommendations for any activity or shopping need you may have.

neighborhood_overview: We're right in the heart of downtown Jersey City.   There's a terrific deli a few doors down, the best bagels EVER a block away and a French bakery around the corner. There are three beautiful parks within walking distance, including Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and The Statue of Liberty.   Everything you need is within walking distance.

The house is located a short walk to a train connecting to NYC. Hop on the light rail train to Exchange Place and transfer to PATH or ferry to NYC from there. Exchange Place offers the most breathtaking view of NYC you canâ€™t miss!!

The house is also within walking distance to Liberty State Park which is a 1200 acre park offering dramatic views of Manhattan, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island!

Walking distance to the iconic Statue of Liberty ferry (30 minute to be exact).

Commute using public transport into downtown NYC takes 35 minutes including all walk, train transfers and wait times during normal hours.

Our neighborhood is called Bergen Lafayette affectionately known as BeLa. It is located just outside downtown Jersey City (about 20 minute walk or a few minute drive). It is an urban neighborhood with diverse residents. Hard working families with young children live here. Many like next door neighbors have been here for over 50

Our property is a 7 minute walk to the Grove Street PATH train station which provides transportation to New York City, Newark Airport, Hoboken, etc. Depending on your destination, it is an approximately 10-20 minutes commute on the PATH train to Manhattan.

Jersey City is a melting pot of international influences from its residents to its varied and appetizing culinary options - Korean, Indian, Filipino, Cuban, Italian, and American.

The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Islands are less than Â½ mile away from Liberty State Parkâ€™s ferry dock. Liberty Science Center is a 10 minutes drive from Urban Base Camp. There are beautiful green spaces - Hamilton Park, Van Vorst Park, and Liberty Park - where kids can frolic and play, where you can walk, run, and cycle, take a picnic and gaze upon Manhattanâ€™s skyline. The Newport area - one stop from Grove PATH station - offers you a mall, large stores, and a beautiful waterfront walkway.

neighborhood_overview:
Guests will be located close to everything in a very safe neighborhood. The area is very unique where you can encounter very cool findings (Restaurants, coffee shops, vintage stores, etc.) You'll be located two blocks away from the Palisade Ave. & Prospect St. bus stops, where you will be able to easily take buses to many tourists attractions.

Jersey City Heights is a residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, while Leonard Gordon Park is known for its early-1900s buffalo and bears statues by sculptor Solon Borglum. Washington Park offers sports courts and a playground.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patt

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a beautiful, growing artist community right above Hoboken. This luxury condo is located right in the formal Riverview Arts District and has numerous coffee places, cafes, restaurants, juice bars, and dessert places opening regularly.

Right at the corner on JFK Blvd, are regular private buses into Port Authority, New York City. These buses take about 15-20 minutes, come every few minutes, and are about $3 per person.

Also right at the corner is NJ Transit Buses which goes to Port Authority for $4.50, but you must have exact change.

NJ Transit App can be downloaded for routes and fares as well as CityMapper app.

Walk a few blocks down on Congress Street and there is the 9th Street Light Rail Station in Hoboken, you can take the rail to the path or ferry and get to Downtown or Midtown Manhattan. This makes for a possibly nicer trip, plus the benefits of access to the entire Gold Coast of New Jersey (Union City to Lib

The Alana - A Chic Duplex 40 Minutes from NYCWelcome to The Alana, a newly renovated flat in the bustling Bergen Lafayette section of Jersey City. neighborhood_overview:
While the majority of our guests come to see NYC, we urge you to explore Jersey Cityâ€™s beautiful Bergen Lafayette as well. Within 10 minutes of the apartment you will find an array of hip new restaurants, bars, and cafes located on the evolving Communipaw Avenue. Grind Coffee Shop is a must if you are a coffee fan. Three blocks from the house is the new Berry Lane Park - host to regular soccer matches and tennis games. Donâ€™t forget to visit Downtown Jersey City for local gems like Torico Ice Cream Shop and Taqueria Downtown.

Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Agai

Easy access via Holland Tunnel (5-10 mins).
Free street parking (except cleaning times).
Experience NYC's allure without the high cost.
neighborhood_overview:
***Neighborhood Gems:
Discover a tranquil and secure neighborhood that welcomes a rich tapestry of diverse ethnicities and cultures. While primarily home to professionals and full-time workers, it also embraces the essence of a close-knit family community.

***Safety and Peace of Mind:
Adjacent to the property, you'll find the courthouse building, ensuring a constant and vigilant presence of security 24/7. Our commitment to safety extends to the property itself, equipped with 24/7 security cameras, providing you with the peace of mind you deserve. In over a decade of residence here, we've never encountered any safety concerns or incidents, a testament to the safety and serenity of our growing community.

Embrace the warmth and security of our neighborhood during your stay.

name: Coco Loft/The Heights, JC
description:
This is a private bedroom with a secure lock located in a historic Jersey City row house. Guests have a comfy queen size bed, and a fold out single size bed. Sleeps 3 people comfortably.

*Note: Guests only have access to the bedroom and the bathroom on the second level. Guests are not allowed in the rest of the house including the kitchen.

* Note: This room is ideal for 2-3 people, but can sleep up to four.

* Thirty - forty minutes away from Midtown New York City via bus or train.
view:
Coco Loft/The Heights, JCThis is a private bedroom with a secure lock located in a historic Jersey City row house. Guests have a comfy queen size bed, and a fold out single size bed. Sleeps 3 people comfortably.

*Note: Guests only have access to the bedroom and the bathroom on the second level. Guests are not allowed in the rest of the house including the kitchen.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is the 6th borough of NYC and super convenient to Manhattan. The house is two blocks away from Central Ave. This is a street full of cheap shopping, restaurants, coffee shops all along the sidewalk. You also will catch the bus to Port Authority in NYC here.

There is also Riverview Park park located four blocks away on 498 Palisade Ave. If you want to go for a scenic walk definitely include this! There a farmers market at Riverview Park which is held every Sunday (rain or shine) from the first Sunday in May through the Sunday before Thanksgiving in November, from 10 am to 3 pm.

neighborhood_overview: There are good coffee, organic ice cream, and other food choices around the area.  There are neighborhood restaurants, bars, markets and delis, and other commercial storefronts all in walking distance, not need for car but can also easily keep a car parked.  There are light rails, buses, and path to take you into the city and other neighboring cities through rail and air travel.   Also, a plus is that there is a lot of parks and the nearest one is only 1-2 blocks away that has a beautiful view of NYC skyline.  It's perfect location to run, jog, or take walks around the area into other neighboring areas such as Hoboken and Downtown Jersey City to NY.  There are fantastic food all over.  Please feel free to ask for any recommendations!

name: Bright, Stylish Garden Apartment minutes to NYC
description: Welcome to our garden apartment in Jersey City. Perfect for tourists trying to see NYC on a budget or for a longer term sublet, our brand new, one bedroom/ one bath is comfortable, stylish and fully stocked. Located in a safe, quiet residential street, it is a perfect place to relax after a day in the city.  Only 3 blocks to the Path train to WTC (in 12 minutes) and Midtown (in 22 minutes) which runs 24/7, making all tourist attractions and shopping very convenient. Groceries, restaurants, etc.

Our street is primarily young families, very quiet and safe, so please no loud parties. It is as close as you can be to the Path into Manhattan (3 blocks) and walking distance to all the amazing restaurants and bars downtown without the noise.
Please ask us about where to go, we are happy to share our insiders' knowledge.

name: Vibrant & bright 3 B/D, deck, Parking 25 mins NYC!
description: Located conveniently between Newark Airport and NYC this private apartment is perfect for out of town visitors. Walk to the train station in 10 minutes and a 15 minute ride will deliver you to the World Trade Center Oculus. The apartment is a stylishly designed and comfortable place to stay after a long day of exploring NYC or Jersey City!
view: Vibrant & bright 3 B/D, deck, Parking 25 mins NYC!Located conveniently between Newark Airport and NYC this private apartment is perfect for out of town visitors. Walk to the train station in 10 minutes and a 15 minute ride will deliver you to the World Trade Center Oculus. The apartment is a stylishly designed and comfortable place to stay after a long day of exploring NYC or Jersey City!
neighborhood_overview:
This is a very safe cosmopolitan neighborhood with a lot of development happening. Lots of dining options within walking distance on Central Ave.

We are very close to downtown Jersey City where you can find fancy restaurants and bars. Hoboken is also close by. Uber and the Citibike are affordable options to go to the Path Station and downtown, even to Hoboken. This apartment is close to Manhattan and offers great value for those venturing into the city.

neighborhood_overview:
We are a Centuryâ€™s old Guest/Rooming House that has been renovated. We offer European style rooms with shared bathrooms and Continental styled rooms with private bathrooms.
All rooms have microwave ovens, mini refrigerators, desk and chair, Iron, blow dryer, heat and air conditioning (in the summer and spring), sheets, comforter, towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, plastic utensils, plates, bowls, cups, toilet paper and free Wi-Fi.
We also have a laundry room for your use (for a fee) on premises and we will provide you with a refillable laundry card.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, itâ€™s part of the New York metropolitan area. The cityâ€™s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed â€œWall Street Westâ€ for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. neighborhood_overview: My area of Jersey City, the Heights, is very vibrant, eclectic and diverse, with nice cafes and restaurants and it is safe. Some of my favorite local spots are within a couple of blocks of the apartment. Corto restaurant is a favorite and has a farm to table menu, outdoor seating in the backyard and it is BYOB. Fox and Crow is a nice burger spot that has a parlor in the backroom where you can enjoy live music Thursday through Sunday. Also, Riverview Park, just one block away, provides great views of Manhattan, especially at night.  Letâ€™s not forget about the city of Hoboken which is a 3 minute walk from the apartment.

name: Charming Jersey City Height Home
description:
Charming Jersey City Heights home one bus ride away from the city.

We've lived in The Heights for 3 years and love the area!

Take the 119 bus (right around the corner) straight into Manhattan as well as a the 9th street lightrail to the PATH that drops you off in the West Village.

Some neighborhood favorites are Bread & Salt, Sure Things, and Corto JC.

We keep a calm, tidy, welcoming house! We're open to visitors who are respectful of our space (and yours!) and love to have company.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: Comfortable home in Jersey City
description: The house is two short blocks from the Light Rail (Richard Street Stop) which goes to Hoboken Terminal then a short walk to the PATH (Port Authority Trans Hudson) train into the City. About a 30 minute trip if lucky with the timing! The house has a nice view and a comfortable back yard. As an alternate you can walk 15/20 minutes to the Port Liberte ferry to Bowling Green. I have a Steinway grand (in tune!) and often cook dinner which you'd be welcome to join if you want.

neighborhood_overview:
Just one-square-mile (2.5 square kilometers) in size, Hoboken is a small town with everything you love about city life. Washington Street is the main thoroughfare, lined with great restaurants, bars bistro-pubs and rooftop bars. Spend an afternoon exploring quaint cobblestone streets, where youâ€™ll find one-of-a-kind boutiques.

Take in the stunning views of NYC as you bike or stroll along the Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, visiting parks and piers on with way. Join the free yoga class at Pier A or settle in for a movie under the stars at Pier 13 Park. Throughout the year, Hoboken hosts a wide range of concerts and a full schedule of festivals celebrating the arts and foodâ€”from Restaurant Week to The Mutz (Mozzarella) Festival. Thereâ€™s a youthful energy here thatâ€™s infectious.

view: Studio in Best Neighborhood of Jersey CityThis apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 25 years of experience in the industry. This luxury community redefines sophisticated urban living with the comfort and style of home. Building amenities include a 24-hour doorman, fitness center, outdoor pool and resident lounge. neighborhood_overview: Jersey City, located directly across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, offers the best of both worlds. Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The historic neighborhood was once the first destination for immigrants entering through Ellis Island and still remains one of the most diverse areas of New Jersey. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.

name: Charming 1 Bedroom 20 Mins to Midtown NYC
description: This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 25 years of experience in the industry. This luxury community redefines sophisticated urban living with the comfort and style of home. Building amenities include a 24-hour doorman, fitness center, outdoor pool and resident lounge. Situated near the PATH train, Grove Pointe provides convenient commutes to NYC and other parts of New Jersey.
view: Charming 1 Bedroom 20 Mins to Midtown NYCThis apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 25 years of experience in the industry. This luxury community redefines sophisticated urban living with the comfort and style of home. Building amenities include a 24-hour doorman, fitness center, outdoor pool and resident lounge. Situated near the PATH train, Grove Pointe provides convenient commutes to NYC and other parts of New Jersey.
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City, located directly across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, offers the best of both worlds. Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooking the Manhattan skyline. The historic neighborhood was once the first destination for immigrants entering through Ellis Island and still remains one of the most diverse areas of New Jersey. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.

name: Private 1BR in heart of downtown Jersey City
description: Large one bedroom with king bed. Close to PATH train with 24hr access to Manhattan. Small garden with private deck.  Walking distance to supermarket, restaurants and coffee shops. High speed internet. Fully equipped galley kitchen. Free street parking on holidays and weekends.

Walking distance to supermarket, restaurants and coffee shops. High speed internet. Fully equipped galley kitchen. Free street parking on holidays and weekends.
neighborhood_overview: The Grove Street area location of the apartment makes it extremely close to Manhattan via the PATH train. Ferries, a light rail (HBLR) and buses also provide additional access to NYC as well as local spots. The local neighborhood surrounding the apartment is just as interesting as NYC and everyone knows the best views of Manhattan are actually from the Jersey City waterfront (a great place for a stroll, run or photo op). Grove Street is just as convenient as Manhattan in many ways and you will find yourself a short walk from dozens of restaurants, bars and shops. The area boasts several parks (including Liberty State Park with Liberty Science Center as well as access to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island), ice rinks, Newport Mall (130 stores and a movie theater), boating, and performance venues.. Several farmerâ€™s markets, craft fairs, live outdoor music, holiday events and a midnight foodie market lend to the local vibe. You will also find a huge amount of diversity in Jersey City,

name: Cozy 2BR Garden Suite w/ Patio | Near NYC & DT JC
description:
This is a cozy & eclectic 2-bdrm garden level apt w/ easy free street parking, separate entrance & small patio w/ seating. The kitchen is recently renovated, apt is thoughtfully updated, & a little suburban oasis vibe w/ close proximity to downtown & major roads.

In unit W/D, full bath, TV+WiFi, &thoughtful touches are all available. Perfect stay for business travelers, students, traveling nurses, etc to check out JC, NYC, Newark and surrounding cities. Welcome to our home!
view:
Cozy 2BR Garden Suite w/ Patio | Near NYC & DT JCThis is a cozy & eclectic 2-bdrm garden level apt w/ easy free street parking, separate entrance & small patio w/ seating. The kitchen is recently renovated, apt is thoughtfully updated, & a little suburban oasis vibe w/ close proximity to downtown & major roads.

In unit W/D, full bath, TV+WiFi, &thoughtful touches are all available. Perfect stay for business travelers, students, traveling nurses, etc to check out JC, NYC, Newark and surrounding cities. Welcome to our home!
neighborhood_overview:
Our beautiful garden suite is located on the ground level of a multi family home in a residential enclave right in downtown Jersey City with close proximity to McGinley Square.

Jersey City is the most diverse city in NJ - which means great local food options! Madame, Wurstbar, Brightside Tavern, Liberty House, The Maritime, Surf City Bar, Porta, Ani Ramen, Rasoi, Second Street Bakery, Smorgasborg Harborside JC, East Wind Snack Shop, etc.

Local sights include Liberty State Park, Central Railroad of NJ Terminal, Statue of Liberty, Liberty Science Center, Van Vorst Park, Downtown JC pedestrian plaza w/ restaurants, bars, & shops, White Eagle Hall, and more.

Check out our Guidebook for more recs, or better yet - just ask us!

name: Luxury Furnished Condo Room + Private Bathroom
description:
Furnished room and private bathroom available for rent in Jersey City in Luxury 2 bedroom 2 bath condo. 10 minute walk to JSQ Path Station. $1000 + utilities.

This lovely smarthome internest is filled with cool custom colored lights, fluffy pillows, classic books, vinyl records, and the latest playstation games. The pet-friendly building is a modern luxury loft space converted from a high ceiling warehouse. The massive windows and exposed piping make you feel like an artist just by living here.

view: Studio in the Heart of Downtown Jersey CityThis apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 25 years of experience in the industry. This luxury community redefines sophisticated urban living with the comfort and style of home. Building amenities include a 24-hour doorman, fitness center, outdoor pool and resident lounge. Situated near the PATH train, Grove Pointe provides convenient commutes to NYC and other parts of New Jersey.
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City, located directly across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, offers the best of both worlds. Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The historic neighborhood was once the first destination for immigrants entering through Ellis Island and still remains one of the most diverse areas of New Jersey. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.

The house is fully stocked with complimentary shower liquids, high speed internet, fresh linens, and towels every single stay.

neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

neighborhood_overview:
This space is located in the Bergen-Lafayette fast growing gentrify area in Jersey City, it is a very popular, vibrant and diverse metro area just like NYC. Therefore, you will be able to find simple groceries in corner bodega stores, or access to supermarkets within 10-15 mins walk. The Hudson-Bergen light rail located 7 mins walk take you 2 PATH stations where you transfer to PATH train into NYC, the light rail also go to the Newport Mall in Jersey City directly for shopping.

Light rail ride is 15-20 mins ride, PATH ride is 2-15 mins depends on where you get off in NYC.

Direct bus into NYC Bus Port Authority (one block from Time Square) is 7 mins walk from the house.

The cityâ€™s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed â€œWall Street Westâ€ for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. Adorable garden-level one-bedroom apartment - with great light - available for stays in a historic brick row house in the Bergen Lafayette neighborhood of Jersey City. Ideal for any individual who needs a great place to crash for related work activities or to just chill for a get away - by yourself or with your "boo". It's in a quaint, well managed and quiet building that has a homey and comfortable feeling. Coffee shops and local eateries located on Bergen Avenue and Monticello Avenues - with Uber Eats providing even more options for delivery. Try us out!

*Centrally located, with access to bus lines (2 blocks away) to either Grove Street or Journal Square to catch the PATH into NYC/NJ etc.
*Lightrail above-ground train station within 3/4 mile for travel across Jersey City and surrounding cities
*Access to ferry line (approx 1 mile) to travel to NYC via water
*20-minute car ride to Newark International Airport

This neighborhood is quickly burgeoning with lots of shops, restaurants, bars â€” and new places to explore. The McGinley Square Special Improvement District has also helped in boosting this neighborhood, creating a weekly pop-up Pedestrian Plaza on weekends.

neighborhood_overview:
Located in Hudson County, NJâ€”Jersey City is where urban excitement meets small town charm. Nestled along the west bank of the Hudson River, this cosmopolitan center is surrounded by bustling cities like NYC, Hoboken, and Weehawken.

Within Jersey City itself, Historic Downtown beckons with a delightful mix of historic brownstones and sleek waterfront high-rises, blending old-world charm with modern allure. Here in our downtown neighborhood, the community spirit thrivesâ€”expect warm smiles and perhaps a friendly chat with neighbors. Recognized as the â€œMost Diverse Cityâ€ in the USA, our vibrant city offers a rich cultural tapestry through its myriad of parks, cafes, restaurants, bars, and shops.

Engage in some dog-watching or pick up produce at nearby parks, where Victorian elegance meets farmers markets. Explore Hamilton Park, named after Founding Father Alexander Hamilton and Van Vorst Park, honoring former Mayor Cornelius Van Vorst. Just a short stroll away, disc

You can't see the view of the NYC skyline from the city itself. The best spot is from Jersey City. We are only 7mins drive away from the â€ŽLiberty State Park which is voted #1 best Manhattan view in Jersey City! Enjoy a relaxing dinner at the Liberty House Restuarant with iconic views of the NYC skyline, Ellis Island, and Lady Liberty.

Within 5 mins by drive, there are also a local brewery and a cocktail bar/distillery open until midnight.

Our residential neighborhood is an urban-suburban mixed feel with easily accessible public transportation. The neighbors around are friendly. It is also safe and quiet at night.

We have one security camera on the front porch and one facing the garage. They will be on during your stay. Parking peace of mind all time!

Apartment is located at Newport of Jersey City which is master-planned, mixed-use community in Downtown Jersey City, New Jersey,

Newport consists of retail, residential, office, and entertainment facilities. The neighborhood is situated on the Hudson Waterfront and located opposite Lower Manhattan and the neighborhood of Tribeca in New York City.

The apartment is just next to the Newport Centre Mall, a large traditional indoor shopping complex anchored by Macy's, JCPenney, Sears, Kohl's, H&M, and ZARA.
