description: Recently renovated, beautifully furnished garden level apartment in downtown Jersey City. Enjoy the peace, quiet and safety of the apartmentâ€™s residential street or explore the restaurants and shops of Newark Ave just a block away. Also a 10-minute walk from the PATH which takes you to downtown Manhattan (World Trade Center) in 7 minutes and to midtown Manhattan (33rd St and 6th Ave) in 19 minutes. 20 minute drive to Newark Liberty International Airport

neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is an excellent place to explore in its own right. Within a 15 minute walk you will find more than 30 excellent restaurants including Razza (the best Pizza in NYC, according to the NY Times), Taqueria Downtown (best tacos in NJ, according to us!) and cuisines from all over the world. We also have a thriving art scene with lots of street art; ask Kevin for tips =)
It's only a 20 min walk to the waterfront at Exchange Place where you will have jaw dropping views of Manhattan across the river; there are a few excellent dining options there as well such as Hudson & Co, Lokal JC and DomoDomo.

neighborhood_overview: A suburbia-in-the city setting located on the south west perimeter of New Jersey Route 440 along Newark Bay, and borderline Jersey City.  Community consist of tree lined streets featuring Colonial, Cape Cod, and Ranch Styles homes. Area offers the convenience of city-living with an out of town feel. A short 15 minutes drive or Uber/Lyft ride from Newark International Airport.  Over the past twenty years, Jersey City and most recent Bayonne food scenes have exploded. From Thai to Mexican to Lebanese, multicultural influences have elevated both cities to a diverse and innovative foodie paradise. So whether youâ€™re looking for an Indian restaurant or in the mood for Italian food, youâ€™re guaranteed to find something to satisfy your tastebuds. From seafood to pasta to salad, breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner, both Jersey City and Bayonne got it all.

description: Located in the Journal Square area, this bright and clean 1-bedroom apartment offers easy access to everything you need. The apartment features a queen bed and a queen sleeper sofa, comfortably accommodating up to 4 people. Stay connected with fast WIFI throughout your stay.

The apartment features a queen bed and a queen sleeper sofa, comfortably accommodating up to 4 people. Stay connected with fast WIFI throughout your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

neighborhood_overview: Van Vorst Park is a neighborhood in the Historic Downtown of Jersey City, Hudson County, NJ centered on a park sharing the same name. The neighborhood is located west of Paulus Hook and Marin Boulevard, north of Grand Street, east of the Turnpike Extension, and south of The Village and Christopher Columbus Drive. Much of it is included in the Van Vorst Park Historical District.

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is in northeastern New Jersey. Its eastern waterfront faces the Hudson River where it meets Upper New York Bay. Liberty State Park has panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, the former immigrant gateway. The parkâ€™s Liberty Science Center features interactive exhibits, live animals and an IMAX Dome theater. Bars and ethnic eateries line downtownâ€™s Grove Street.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often simply called The Heights, is a pleasant, somewhat densely packed residential neighborhood in the northern section of Jersey City, which in turn is the second-largest city in the state of New Jersey.

Homes in the area can be most often found in the two- and three-family detached houses which sit on small lots and which dominate the housing stock here, or in the low-rise apartment buildings that also are a considerable presence in the neighborhood. There are also more than a few stately old Victorian and Edwardian houses scattered throughout the streets of the Heights with rental apartments within, especially on Sherman Place and Summit Avenue.

Rental apartments in The Heights are generally considered to be located in the area that's bordered to the south by the Bergen Arches rail tracks and The Divided Highway (also known as the Pulaski Skyway, or Route 139); to the east by Palisade Avenue (and the city of Hoboken); to the north by Patte

Jersey City is home to its own thriving international dining scene, including a number of fantastic Vietnamese restaurants and James Beard Award semifinalist Rick Eastonâ€™s Bread & Salt Bakery, where you can try some amazing Roman-style pizza. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Jersey City, just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan. Jersey Cityâ€™s bustling waterfront is so packed with office tours that it is affectionately known as â€œWall Street Westâ€ among locals. In all, more than 100,000 people are employed within the city. Jersey City is home to its own thriving international dining scene, including a number of fantastic Vietnamese restaurants and James Beard Award semifinalist Rick Eastonâ€™s Bread & Salt Bakery, where you can try some amazing Roman-style pizza. There are also plenty of shops around Journal Square and Newport Centre, a shopping mall located in nearby Newport. Jersey City has excellent public transportation, with both express and local buses and a light rail system. The entire area is well connected to Manhattan via NJ Transitâ€™s PATH train system, which runs 24/7 between several stops in Jersey City and 33rd Street and the World Trade Center in Manhattan.

neighborhood_overview:
Hoboken is a square mile city across the Hudson river from New York City. Hoboken is rich in night life as is boasts the most bars per square mile anywhere in the United States. Guests may take a bus or a train to Manhattan in 20 minutes. The town is extremely safe and there are tons of great places to view the Manhattan Skyline.

Some of our favorite local places to eat in Hoboken & the Heights:
M&P Biancomano's: 11th and Washington Street
Benny Tudino's - Home of the largest slice: 6th and Washington Street
Renato's Pizza Master: Hutton and Central Ave
Otto Strada: 8th and Park Ave
La Isla: 1st and Washington Street
Amanda's: 9th and Washington Street

neighborhood_overview: The JC Pink Spot is located in the center of an up-and-coming neighborhood. It is located 35/40 minutes away from NYC, which was particularly important to me. While being on a busy commercial block you will hear street traffic during your stay as we are  on the corner of a major Boulevard. We are located near various convince stores and shopping centers. As well as being minutes away from the nightlife in both Jersey City, Newark, and Bayonne. There are many attractions we are in proximity to, such as the Prudential Center, MET Life, Top Golf, and American Dream, which are only 30-45 minutes away. The neighborhood is far from quiet and Surburban. However, those are all of the parts I love as I am and will always be a New York City girl at heart.

neighborhood_overview:
Perched atop the New Jersey Palisades, you will be staying in the popular Riverview Arts District (Jersey City Heights) overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline! This neighborhood is becoming a go-to spot for new residents and tourists alike.
A multitude of shops, a plethora of international restaurants, public transport, gyms, and parks are all a short walking distance away.

Oh, did we mention: one of the best NYC skyline views is just a 4 mins walk away from our place! -- but don't tell anyone -- this view spot is a local secret ;)
You can also enjoy yoga in the park, the farmer's market on Saturday and Sunday, and great coffee shops such as the iconic Modcup.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

Pop into any of the many corner bars throughout this neighborhood. Each bar has a slightly different flavor (though most promise at least a beer and a bite to eat!) and every local swears loyalty to â€œtheirâ€ beloved bar. Rising above Jersey City, the Heights boast truly spectacular views of the Manhattan skyline. As the sun sets on Riverview Fisk Park, unobstructed views allow you to take in the full splendor of the cityâ€™s lights. The Heights additionally boasts its own lush green fields in Pershing Field Park, aquatic diversions at the Reservoir, fresh adventures through the Riverview Farmers Market or strolls through the Riverview Arts District. The neighborhood is perched atop the New Jersey Palisades, overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is becoming a go-to spot for new residents and tourists alike.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Jersey City, just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan. Jersey Cityâ€™s bustling waterfront is so packed with office tours that it is affectionately known as â€œWall Street Westâ€ among locals. In all, more than 100,000 people are employed within the city. Jersey City is home to its own thriving international dining scene, including a number of fantastic Vietnamese restaurants and James Beard Award semifinalist Rick Eastonâ€™s Bread & Salt Bakery, where you can try some amazing Roman-style pizza. There are also plenty of shops around Journal Square and Newport Centre, a shopping mall located in nearby Newport. Jersey City has excellent public transportation, with both express and local buses and a light rail system. The entire area is well connected to Manhattan via NJ Transitâ€™s PATH train system, which runs 24/7 between several stops in Jersey City and 33rd Street and the World Trade Center in Manhattan.

neighborhood_overview:
Perched above Hoboken and offering stunning views of the Manhattan skyline, "The Heights" is a burgeoning neighborhood in Jersey City, NJ, quickly becoming a favorite destination for tourists. And itâ€™s easy to see why! From Riverview-Fisk Park, located between Palisade and Ogden Avenues, you can take in breathtaking views of the Hudson River and the iconic Manhattan skyline. For early risers, a stroll to the park's observation deck at sunrise provides a tranquil experience, as you witness the dawn break over NYCâ€”one of the most peaceful moments that The Heights has to offer.

Jersey City is the most ethnically diverse city in both New Jersey and the United States, a richness reflected in the wide array of ethnic restaurants that grace The Heights. Most dining spots, bars, coffee shops, and parks can be found along Central Avenue, while trendier options are situated on Palisade Avenue. neighborhood_overview:
***Neighborhood Gems:
Discover a tranquil and secure neighborhood that welcomes a rich tapestry of diverse ethnicities and cultures. While primarily home to professionals and full-time workers, it also embraces the essence of a close-knit family community.

***Safety and Peace of Mind:
Adjacent to the property, you'll find the courthouse building, ensuring a constant and vigilant presence of security 24/7. Our commitment to safety extends to the property itself, equipped with 24/7 security cameras, providing you with the peace of mind you deserve. In over a decade of residence here, we've never encountered any safety concerns or incidents, a testament to the safety and serenity of our growing community.

neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

neighborhood_overview: A residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, while Leonard Gordon Park is known for its early-1900s buffalo and bears statues by sculptor Solon Borglum. Washington Park offers sports courts and a playground.

Our house is located between Jersey City's top schools - Saint Peter's University and New Jersey City University. description:
This apartment is perfect for families, couples, and small groups of friends. With a modern and stylish interior, you'll feel right at home as soon as you enter.

The spacious living room is the perfect place to relax after a long day and
the kitchen is fully equipped with all the necessary appliances.

Gorgeous Rennovated ApartmentThis apartment is perfect for families, couples, and small groups of friends. With a modern and stylish interior, you'll feel right at home as soon as you enter.

neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in a residential/ urban area of Jersey City, known as Bergen Lafayette.  In the last few years the area has been going through a gentrification process, and this is reflected in the neighborhood;  some parts are very modern while other parts are about to upgraded.  This apartment is nestled on a hill, whereby you can see Manhattan and is very close to public transportation, 'the light-rail', making it a great place to stay if you want to explore Manhattan.  There is an American style bar (pub) across the road from the apartment, whereby you can get American food and local drinks.  A modern coffee shop 'The Grind' is 10 Min away too.  I would generally suggest taking an Uber in the evening, from the Path Station Exchange Pl or Journal Square, which generally costs $10.00

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Jersey City Heights, a vibrant and diverse neighborhood that offers a unique blend of urban living and community charm. Situated atop the Palisades, this elevated neighborhood provides stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River.

Jersey City Heights is known for its tree-lined streets, historic brownstones, and a lively atmosphere. Explore Central Avenue, the main commercial corridor, where you'll find an array of local shops, restaurants, and cafes to satisfy your culinary cravings. From international cuisine to cozy coffee shops, there's something for every palate.

Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the neighborhood's proximity to several parks, such as Pershing Field Park, where you can enjoy green spaces, playgrounds, and sports facilities. Take a leisurely stroll or bike ride along the scenic Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, offering breathtaking views and a tranquil escape from the bustling city.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

neighborhood_overview:
Location! Location! Location!
A residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, basketball court, tennis court, and playground. All public transportation is within 12-15 minutes of walking distance. The Heights is one of Jersey City, NJ's safest neighborhoods.

view:
Private Bedroom & Bath w/ Patio | 2-Stops from NYCWelcome to our spacious, private 1-bedroom with private bath in Historic Downtown Jersey City. Steps away from downtown's bestâ€”restaurants, bars, shops, parks, & local farmers markets!

neighborhood_overview:
Downtown is best known and loved for its charming historical architecture. Four of the five historic districts are Downtown where beautiful brownstones beguile along tree-lined streets in Harsimus Cove and around namesake parks in neighborhoods like Van Vorst Park and Hamilton Park.

The condo is located in the downtown section called Paulus Hook. Tucked between Exchange Place and the Colgate Clock along the Hudson River, it is one of the most sought-after historic districts. There, you can find leafy side streets dotted with restaurants, shops, and magnificent brownstones.

Downtown offers the most transportation options with three PATH trains stations and three NY Waterway ferry stops, making the commute to NYC less than 10 minutes. Buses and the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail are accessible as well. Downtown is also the beating heart of the bar, restaurant, and retail scene, but neighborhoods farther out, originally built as suburbs of Jersey City, are just as enlive

description:

The historic downtown has many million-dollar brownstones and row houses filled with charming historical 1800â€™s characteristics. Jersey City just recently spent 7 million dollars upgrading its main upscare pedestrian walkway downtown area with all stores and restaurants. A super fast commute to NYC with many restaurants and boutiques: walk to the subway and ride just 5 minutes to NYC World Trade Center.

The house, built in 1856, is located in Downtown Jersey City with a lot to offer: CafÃ©s, Restaurants ( Orale - Mexican cuisine Razza Pizza), Bars (Dullboy, The Ashford), Pharmacies ( CVS, Walgreens, Medly), and just minutes to Hudson River Waterfront Walkway (walk along the water and enjoy stunning views of NYC). neighborhood_overview:
Given Jersey City's proximity and accessibility by rapid transit to Manhattan, Jersey City is sometimes referred to as New York City's Sixth borough. Redevelopment of the Jersey City waterfront has made the city one of the largest centers of banking and finance in the United States and has led to the district and city being nicknamed Wall Street West. Our house is located between Jersey City's top schools - Saint Peter's University and New Jersey City University.

Thereâ€™s a 24 hour 7-eleven and Walgreens 1 minute drive/6min walk from the house.

neighborhood_overview:
Situated in the heart of Jersey City, this property offers an ideal location in a vibrant and diverse neighborhood just minutes from Manhattan. Known for its eclectic mix of culture, history, and urban charm, Jersey City is a hub for foodies, art enthusiasts, and city explorers alike. The apartment is nestled on a peaceful residential street, providing a tranquil retreat while being within walking distance of local cafes, restaurants, and shops.

Take a short stroll to Journal Square, where you'll find an array of dining options, from authentic ethnic cuisine to modern bistros. Don't miss Mana Contemporary, a renowned art and cultural center showcasing innovative exhibitions and performances. For those who love the outdoors, Lincoln Park is nearby, offering lush greenery, scenic walking paths, and sports facilities for relaxation or recreation.

The Hudson River waterfront is a short ride away, featuring Liberty State Park, a sprawling green space with picnic areas,

neighborhood_overview:
This is a very diverse neighborhood located it a metropolitan area. Residents on our street are mostly working professionals and retirees. The home is located on a quiet one-way street not on the main road.

You may hear the occasional sounds of emergency vehicles passing by from time to time or the garbage truck doing its rounds on trash pickup nights.

There is only street parking available on a first come basis, no designated parking. Please do not block people's driveways or park by fire hydrants because you will be ticketed.

There is alternate side parking on street cleaning days. Please ensure you pay close attention to the signs posted showing cleaning days and times to avoid getting a ticket.

Located on the picturesque west banks of the Hudson River, Newport stands as an extraordinary 600-acre master-planned community in the heart of Downtown Jersey City, New Jersey, United States. This vibrant neighborhood is a harmonious blend of retail, residential, office, and entertainment facilities, forming a dynamic and diverse urban oasis.

With the stunning backdrop of the Hudson Waterfront, Newport provides unmatched views of the iconic downtown Manhattan skyline. As you leisurely walk along the Hudson River, you will be captivated by the world-renowned vistas, allowing you to fully immerse yourself in the breathtaking beauty and vibrant energy that characterizes Lower Manhattan and the esteemed neighborhood of Tribeca in New York City.

name: Beautiful private 1-bedroom in Historic Downtown
description: Welcome to a serene stay in this well appointed 1-BR apartment in a restored traditional 1800's brick row-house, located in the heart of Jersey City Historic Downtown.  This newly renovated unit has all the modern amenities, including a luxury kitchen and bathroom.   Enjoy lovely walks to Hamilton, Van Vorst and Liberty State Parks or spend your time in the many neighborhood coffee shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.  Getting to NYC midtown and downtown is a mere 20 min. via PATH or Ferry.
view: Beautiful private 1-bedroom in Historic DowntownWelcome to a serene stay in this well appointed 1-BR apartment in a restored traditional 1800's brick row-house, located in the heart of Jersey City Historic Downtown.  This newly renovated unit has all the modern amenities, including a luxury kitchen and bathroom.   Enjoy lovely walks to Hamilton, Van Vorst and Liberty State Parks or spend your time in the many neighborhood coffee shops, cafes, bars and restaurants.  Getting to NYC midtown and downtown is a mere 20 min. via PATH or Ferry.
neighborhood_overview:
Harsimus Cove is located in the rejuvenated Historic Downtown with beautiful brownstone and brick row houses from the 1800's.

There are lovely walks to Hamilton, Van Vorst and Liberty State Parks or take walks around the streets to check out the many murals painted by local artists.

Guests can partake in the many culinary delights, including artisan coffee shops, bakeries and ice cream shops, multi-culinary restaurants and cafes. Nightlife is always hopping with trendy bars, speakeasies and beer gardens, as well as breweries and distilleries.

Convenience - Key Foods grocery is 1-Block away as are dry cleaners and shoe repairs.

name: SkyHouse JC - New 3BR Apt w/ Rooftop & Parking
description: Welcome to SkyHouse JC! With free driveway parking, stay in this chic condo in the historic Jersey City Heights - perfect for a family vacation or work-cation. Enjoy stunning views of the NYC skyline from the rooftop, prepare gourmet meals from the open-concept kitchen, and relax in luxurious bedrooms with memory foam mattresses. Take advantage of nearby light rail/buses to explore Downtown JC, Hoboken & Manhattan (20 min), or simply walk to local coffee shops, restaurants, and more!
view: SkyHouse JC - New 3BR Apt w/ Rooftop & ParkingWelcome to SkyHouse JC! With free driveway parking, stay in this chic condo in the historic Jersey City Heights - perfect for a family vacation or work-cation. Enjoy stunning views of the NYC skyline from the rooftop, prepare gourmet meals from the open-concept kitchen, and relax in luxurious bedrooms with memory foam mattresses. Take advantage of nearby light rail/buses to explore Downtown JC, Hoboken & Manhattan (20 min), or simply walk to local coffee shops, restaurants, and more!
neighborhood_overview: JC Heights is a closely knit, ethnically diverse and bustling neighborhood. There is always a new store or pop-up-event happening, but there are many tried and true staples within a few blocks as well. The neighborhood is flanked by 2 commercial arteries, Central and Palisade Avenue, which is home to many restaurants and conveniences including bodegas, salons, dry cleaners, post-office, flower shop, dispensaries, pharmacies, Covid-testing centers, and shoes stores. Nearby Riverview and Washington Parks are the heart of outdoor life for our neighborhood with skyline views, green spaces for picnics and walks, dog parks, playgrounds, playing fields and splash pads. If we are lucky enough to host you between May and November, you can enjoy the bounties of the Riverview Farmerâ€™s Market every Sunday and other seasonal fairs. Below are only some of our neighborhood favorites in a 10 block radius.  If you enjoyed a particular place in our neighborhood during your stay that is not on this list,

neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

description:
Nestled in the heart of downtown Jersey City you'll love this treelined, peaceful city block with access to the lively downtown Jersey City area and minutes away from NYC.

You'll have a short walk (5-7 minutes) to the Grove Street PATH Station which is two stops away from NYC and also within walking distance of the Paulus Hook Ferry station if you would like a breezier mode of transport into NYC.

Come enjoy this recently renovated apartment that's been designed to make you feel at home.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

name: JC Cozy Home 1
description:
This is a private bedroom we rent in our home; we rent two private bedrooms in this home and those rooms share a bathroom. The owners have their own bathroom. We offer a shared kitchen and living space and take pride in offering a comfortable and clean place to stay. We ask guests to not wear shoes in the home.

There are original Hardwood Floors throughout, 10ft ceilings, great natural light, a designated working space, and the bedroom has clothing storage. We offer onsite parking for a fee.
view:
JC Cozy Home 1This is a private bedroom we rent in our home; we rent two private bedrooms in this home and those rooms share a bathroom. The owners have their own bathroom. We offer a shared kitchen and living space and take pride in offering a comfortable and clean place to stay. We ask guests to not wear shoes in the home.

There are original Hardwood Floors throughout, 10ft ceilings, great natural light, a designated working space, and the bedroom has clothing storage. We offer onsite parking for a fee.
neighborhood_overview:
We are in Jersey City heights which is a local community that has been ranked the most diverse city in America for the past 4 years.

You can try every type of restaurant you can imagine on Central Avenue. It's not fancy, it's authentic. We have Puerto Rican, Dominican, Polish, Italian, Mexican, Indian, Vietnamese, Chinese, and Cuban.

There is a park 2 blocks away with tennis courts, basketball, workout equipment, baseball, and great walking paths.

About 10 blocks away is a beautiful view of Manhattan and New York.

Laundry, Supermarket and Convenience Stores located just a block away!

A peaceful getaway perfect for anyone looking to be close to the NYC area!

This Apt. is located on the 3rd FL and you must climb stairs.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the Heights!
Jersey City Heights is a vibrant neighborhood in Jersey City, known for its diverse community and proximity to Manhattan.
The area is home to wonderful local bars, amazing restaurants, and cute cafes. Riverview Fisk Park offers stunning views of the Manhattan skyline, as well as a playground, a picnic area, and a dog park. Pershing Field is another great option for a leisurely stroll or a game of bocce ball.

neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of Jersey City, this neighborhood is a vibrant and thriving area with plenty of activities to explore. The Canvas Condo is just a short walk away from the PATH station, which provides easy access to New York City and other parts of New Jersey. The condo is also close to major highways which makes driving easy too!

Downtown Jersey City is also within walking distance, where you can find a variety of shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues. Take a stroll down Newark Avenue to explore the bustling street and try out some of the local cuisine, including Indian, Italian, and Mexican.

Liberty State Park is just a short distance away and provides a picturesque setting for outdoor activities such as picnics, fishing, and kayaking. The park also has stunning views of the Statue of Liberty and the New York City skyline.

For history buffs, the nearby Ellis Island National Museum of Immigration provides a fascinating look into the history

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a vibrant and diverse city located in the state of New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Here are some highlights about Jersey City:

Location: Jersey City is just minutes away from Manhattan, making it a popular choice for people who want to travel to New York City but don't want to pay the high prices of lodging in Manhattan.

Cultural Diversity: Jersey City is home to a rich and diverse community, with people from all over the world calling it home. This diversity is reflected in the city's vibrant food scene, with a wide range of restaurants serving cuisines from around the world.

Art and Culture: Jersey City is a hub of creativity and artistic expression, with many galleries, museums, and public art installations throughout the city. The annual Jersey City Art and Studio Tour is a popular event that showcases the work of local artists.

Parks and Recreation: Jersey City has a variety of parks and green spac

neighborhood_overview:
Hoboken is a square mile city across the Hudson river from New York City. Hoboken is rich in night life as is boasts the most bars per square mile anywhere in the United States. Guests may take a bus or a train to Manhattan in 20 minutes. The town is extremely safe and there are tons of great places to view the Manhattan Skyline.

Some of our favorite local places to eat in Hoboken & the Heights:
M&P Biancomano's: 11th and Washington Street
Benny Tudino's - Home of the largest slice: 6th and Washington Street
Renato's Pizza Master: Hutton and Central Ave
Otto Strada: 8th and Park Ave
La Isla: 1st and Washington Street
Amanda's: 9th and Washington Street

neighborhood_overview:
Van Vorst Park is a historic neighborhood located in downtown Jersey City, New Jersey, just west of the bustling Grove Street area. The neighborhood is named after the beautiful and centrally-located Van Vorst Park, which serves as a popular gathering place for locals.

The Van Vorst Park neighborhood is known for its tree-lined streets, beautiful brownstones, and historic architecture. Many of the homes in the area were built in the 19th century and have been meticulously restored and maintained over the years, giving the neighborhood a charming and elegant feel.

neighborhood_overview:
The Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City is home to a number of great places to eat and drink. Whether you're looking for a quick bite to eat or a sit-down meal, there's something for everyone in this vibrant neighborhood.

Some of our favorite places to eat in Bergen-Lafayette include Pinwheel Garden, Mordi's Sandwich Shop, Martha's, and Harry's Daughter. Each of these restaurants has its own unique atmosphere and offers something different for diners.

The perfect place to start the day is The Grind Coffee Shop serving not just incredible coffee, but decadent baked goods.

Pinwheel Garden is a great spot for lunch or dinner. The restaurant has a garden-like setting with an outdoor patio that's perfect for enjoying a meal on a nice day. The menu features a variety of fresh, healthy, and delicious options, making it a great choice for those looking for a healthy meal.

Mordi's Sandwich Shop is a popular lunch spot for locals and visitors alik

neighborhood_overview:
The Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City is home to a number of great places to eat and drink. Whether you're looking for a quick bite to eat or a sit-down meal, there's something for everyone in this vibrant neighborhood.

Some of our favorite places to eat in Bergen-Lafayette include Pinwheel Garden, Mordi's Sandwich Shop, Martha's, and Harry's Daughter. Each of these restaurants has its own unique atmosphere and offers something different for diners.

The perfect place to start the day is The Grind Coffee Shop serving not just incredible coffee, but decadent baked goods.

Pinwheel Garden is a great spot for lunch or dinner. The restaurant has a garden-like setting with an outdoor patio that's perfect for enjoying a meal on a nice day. The menu features a variety of fresh, healthy, and delicious options, making it a great choice for those looking for a healthy meal.

Mordi's Sandwich Shop is a popular lunch spot for locals and visitors alik

name: Ultra Modern Room: Town House, 5 min to NYC train
description:
Kick back and relax in this new ultra-modern lower level of my town house, which is now one of the most loved homes on AirBNB in Jersey City. It has clean mid-century modern interior design vibes, and a cozy home-away-from-home feel you can never get in a hotel with over 60 amenities.

A 5 minute walk to NYC bound train and 30 minute transit commute to lower Manhattan, this house is located on a quiet street in Jersey City. It was featured on homestudio list for its excellent interior design.
view:
Ultra Modern Room: Town House, 5 min to NYC trainKick back and relax in this new ultra-modern lower level of my town house, which is now one of the most loved homes on AirBNB in Jersey City. It has clean mid-century modern interior design vibes, and a cozy home-away-from-home feel you can never get in a hotel with over 60 amenities.

A 5 minute walk to NYC bound train and 30 minute transit commute to lower Manhattan, this house is located on a quiet street in Jersey City. It was featured on homestudio list for its excellent interior design.
neighborhood_overview:
The street is in the Bergen-Lafayette area of Jersey City and is up and coming. Berry Lane park with its basketball and tennis courts is a five minute walk away. It is the one of the biggest recreational parks in Jersey City. There's also a baseball field and a football pitch, where you can watch people say soccer, rugby and football all through the week.

Liberty State park is also a 15 to 25 minute leisurely walk away from my house.

For information on good places to eat in the area, check out my guidebook.
To find out what is going on in New York City the week you're traveling you can look up Time Out NYC and New York Adventure Club.

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in a charming residential neighborhood, our luxurious 2-bedroom escape offers an ideal location for travelers seeking both tranquility and urban convenience. Designed for travelers without a vehicle, our haven is a short 6-minute stroll from the Journal Square PATH station, granting you quick access to midtown or downtown NYC in under 30 minutes door to door.

Just around the corner, you'll find Indian Town, a hub of diverse ethnic dining and unique shopping experiences. For coffee enthusiasts, the neighborhood boasts multiple inviting coffee shops, perfect for a delightful sip or a moment of relaxation.

Explore the dynamic cityscape, then retreat to the serene ambiance of our residential oasis, where the best of Jersey City is right at your doorstep.

name: Mid-century modern bedroom [2B][25 mins to NYC!]
description: Welcome to your private room in our newly renovated 3BD/1BA apartment! The apartment has undergone a complete gut renovation, featuring a kitchen with quartz countertops and new appliances, modern bathrooms, minisplit AC units for individual temperature control, hardwood floors, electronic locks, and a door buzzer system for added security and convenience. Everything has been carefully designed to provide a seamless and enjoyable stay.
view: Mid-century modern bedroom [2B][25 mins to NYC!]Welcome to your private room in our newly renovated 3BD/1BA apartment! The apartment has undergone a complete gut renovation, featuring a kitchen with quartz countertops and new appliances, modern bathrooms, minisplit AC units for individual temperature control, hardwood floors, electronic locks, and a door buzzer system for added security and convenience. Everything has been carefully designed to provide a seamless and enjoyable stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Conveniently located, our apartment offers easy access to the vibrant city of New York. The PATH train is just a 15-minute walk or a quick 5-minute Uber ride away, providing a hassle-free commute to iconic destinations such as the World Trade Center (only 25 minutes away) and the Empire State Building (just 35 minutes away). After a day of exploring, return to the comfort of your private room and relax in tranquility.

Nestled in the charming Hamilton Park neighborhood of Jersey City, our apartment allows you to experience the best of both worlds. Enjoy the peacefulness of tree-lined streets and the beauty of Hamilton Park, known for its historical significance and well-maintained green spaces. This family-friendly neighborhood offers a variety of dining options, cozy cafes, and boutique shops to explore. With its close proximity to Manhattan, you'll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the bustling city life while enjoying the laid-back atmosphere of Hamilton Park.

neighborhood_overview:
Local Charm: Jewett Ave offers a glimpse into the everyday life of Jersey City residents. You can experience the neighborhood's unique character and immerse yourself in the local culture.

Accessibility: The neighborhood provides easy access to transportation options, making it convenient for tourists to explore the area. The Journal Square PATH station is nearby, offering a direct link to Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey.

Nearby Amenities: There are several amenities within walking distance, such as grocery stores, restaurants, and shops, ensuring that you have everything you need for a comfortable stay.

Proximity to Attractions: While Jewett Ave itself is a residential street, it is located in close proximity to popular attractions in Jersey City, such as Liberty State Park, Newport Centre Mall, and Downtown Jersey City. These attractions offer a variety of entertainment, shopping, and dining experiences for tourists to enjoy.

Overall

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

neighborhood_overview:
Residents who truly grew up in this area call this neighborhood "The Island", because it feels like our own private island in Jersey City. Everyone is generally very welcoming and easy to approach, it is a very safe area.

-5 minutes' walk from local cuisine (Filipino, Italian, Portugues, and Chinese to name a few)

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a vibrant and diverse city located in the state of New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Here are some highlights about Jersey City:

Location: Jersey City is just minutes away from Manhattan, making it a popular choice for people who want to travel to New York City but don't want to pay the high prices of lodging in Manhattan.

Cultural Diversity: Jersey City is home to a rich and diverse community, with people from all over the world calling it home. This diversity is reflected in the city's vibrant food scene, with a wide range of restaurants serving cuisines from around the world.

Art and Culture: Jersey City is a hub of creativity and artistic expression, with many galleries, museums, and public art installations throughout the city. The annual Jersey City Art and Studio Tour is a popular event that showcases the work of local artists.

Children and dogs are welcome.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is one of the most multicultural diversity city in USA. Jersey City Heights, "The Heights", is a family friendly and safe area with convenient local business and service. Our house is located on a quite street. There are a lot of restaurants, groceries, bakeries and supermarket and other service on Central ave, which is only two blocks away.

Pershing Field and the Reservoir, originally constructed in 1871 are cross the street.

For anyone who want fast access to Manhattan and reasonable dwelling price, this is idea place to stay.

neighborhood_overview:
VAN VORST HOUSE is conveniently located in downtown Jersey City, New Jersey, which is in a historic, quiet, charming neighborhood full of brownstone homes and trees. Jersey City and Hoboken, in Hudson County, are sometimes referred to as the â€œSixth Borough of New York Cityâ€ given their proximity to Manhattan. Jersey City is the affordable alternative for NYC travel. Located one mile from lower Manhattan, it's easily accessible by PATH, ferry, bus or train. A shopper's paradise with no sales tax on clothing or shoes and 3.5 percent sales tax in our UEZ zones, which is one half the normal tax rate.

Our property is 3 blocks / less than 10 mins walk away from Grove St PATH station. The PATH train can take you to Downtown Manhattan in less than 10 minutes to World Trade Center / Oculus. Additionally, you can get to 9th Street, 14th Street, 23rd Street and 33rd Street within minutes with no traffic. The PATH trains run as frequently as every 5 minutes during the peak hours and eve

name: Full size apt. close to NYC
description:
Location! Location! Location!
A residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, basketball court, tennis court, and playground. All public transportation is within 12-15 minutes of walking distance. The Heights is one of Jersey City, NJ's safest neighborhood.

name: Skylight Loft
description: Sunny, quiet, spacious, this urban hideaway is close to Manhattan, yet far away from city hubbub. Sleep well after visiting/working in NYC/JC, but please remember to bring an eye mask. The 6x8 ft skylight fills the loft with natural light. The skylight, wood posts and steel beams are original from the ironworks. New is the comfortable radiant ceiling heat and eco renovation. This location has 3 rare perks: easy street parking, wide ground floor access, and, it's quiet! 2 guests only, no parties!

neighborhood_overview: Located just across the Hudson River from New York City, Jersey City is ranked one of the most diverse cities in the US. It is the  most and booming area in New Jersey. Depending on what Jersey City neighborhoods you check out, you will find a thriving downtown or venture into quiet residential streets with great views and vast green spaces. Our neighborhood is Jersey City Heights also borders Hoboken which is also an amazing city with an incredible waterfront and you can take the Ferry to Nyc. Travel locally by bus or light rail train. Visit Newport Mall, a great bar/nightlife area in downtown near Grove Street.

name: The Palisade Penthouse - Minutes to NYC
description: From this central location, easily access NYC, downtown JC, Hoboken, and the neighborhood!  The Palisade Penthouse, newly renovated, is located on the top floor of a historic building in the beautiful Jersey City Heights neighborhood. With direct buses to NYC stopping on the corner, to walking, light rail, PATH, and reasonable Uber options all within reach, The Palisade Penthouse will meet all your needs for a fun stay in the NYC area!
view: The Palisade Penthouse - Minutes to NYCFrom this central location, easily access NYC, downtown JC, Hoboken, and the neighborhood!  The Palisade Penthouse, newly renovated, is located on the top floor of a historic building in the beautiful Jersey City Heights neighborhood. With direct buses to NYC stopping on the corner, to walking, light rail, PATH, and reasonable Uber options all within reach, The Palisade Penthouse will meet all your needs for a fun stay in the NYC area!
neighborhood_overview: The Heights overlooks Hoboken from the Palisades, and because Hoboken is a historic district with height restrictions there are no high rises affording the Heights protected NYC views. Central Avenue and Palisade Avenue boast immaculate Manhattan skyline and Hudson River vistas.Jersey City Heights exudes a vibrant yet almost cozy ambiance, blending bustling city energy with a welcoming community spirit. It's a diverse and inclusive neighborhood where local businesses thrive, accompanied by green spaces that offer a refreshing retreat from the city's hustle and bustle. Our city views are unrivaled, thanks to the unique advantage of elevated heights that provide an unmatched vantage point to overlook and embrace the entire cityscape.

view: Chic & Modern | 35 Mins to NYC | Extended StaysWelcome to your home away from home! Nestled in the Bergen Lafayette area of Jersey City, our cozy 3-bedroom, 1-bath apartment is the perfect retreat for your extended stay. Whether you're in town for work, studies, or simply exploring the vibrant surroundings, this space offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of local charm.
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled along the picturesque shores of the Hudson River, Jersey City, NJ, stands as a vibrant and dynamic destination, offering a unique blend of urban energy and community charm. Just a stone's throw away from the iconic skyline of Manhattan, Jersey City boasts a personality all its own.

Cityscape:
The cityscape is a mosaic of architectural wonders, from historic brownstones to sleek modern skyscrapers. Take a stroll along the waterfront for breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, or wander through diverse neighborhoods each with its own character and cultural flair.

Cultural Melting Pot:
Jersey City proudly embraces its cultural diversity, creating a melting pot of flavors, traditions, and artistic expressions. Explore the diverse culinary scene, where global cuisines converge in a gastronomic celebration. The vibrant arts scene reflects the city's creative spirit, with galleries, performances, and street art adding color to the urban landscape.<

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of Jersey City, our charming Airbnb listing offers a delightful urban retreat with easy access to all the attractions of the bustling tri-state area. Whether you're a solo traveler, a couple seeking a romantic getaway, or a small family on vacation, our cozy and stylishly appointed apartment is the perfect home base for your Jersey City and NYC adventure.

Jersey City offers a diverse range of experiences and attractions, and our Airbnb listing puts you within mins of many of them. Here are some neighborhood highlights:

1. Waterfront Walkway: Take a short ride on the light rail and stroll along the picturesque Hudson River waterfront and take in stunning views of Manhattan. Don't forget to catch a mesmerizing sunset!

2. Dining and Nightlife: Discover a vibrant culinary scene with a variety of restaurants, cafes, and bars. From local eats to international cuisine, there's something to satisfy every palate.

name: Downtown JC Apartment with Loft
description: Fully renovated 1 bed 1 bathroom on the 1st floor of a brownstone directly located on historic Hamilton Park. The apartment is modern and cozy and has all the amenities you'll need for a comfortable stay. The Hamilton Park neighborhood is one of the most vibrant and prestigious areas in downtown Jersey City. The apartment is within steps of amazing restaurants, nightlife, and shopping.  It's only a 10-15 minute walk to the Newport and Grove Street PATH Trains which take you to NYC.
view: Downtown JC Apartment with LoftFully renovated 1 bed 1 bathroom on the 1st floor of a brownstone directly located on historic Hamilton Park. The apartment is modern and cozy and has all the amenities you'll need for a comfortable stay. The Hamilton Park neighborhood is one of the most vibrant and prestigious areas in downtown Jersey City. The apartment is within steps of amazing restaurants, nightlife, and shopping.  It's only a 10-15 minute walk to the Newport and Grove Street PATH Trains which take you to NYC.
neighborhood_overview: The Hamilton Park neighborhood is in the heart of downtown Jersey City. It's known for its historical brownstones and incredible restaurants, convenient shopping, and nightlife. This apartment sits directly on the park and is a 10-15 minute walk to either the Newport or Grove Street Path Trains. You can also catch the bus to midtown NYC across the street or take a relaxing ferry ride. The area is located close to the JC waterfront and a 10 minute walk to the Newport Center Mall.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey Heights area in Jersey City is a typical, safe metropolitan NYC area community. Our house is located on a quite street. There are a lot of restaurants, groceries, bakeries and supermarket on central ave which is only two blocks away. We do recommend the "DULCE DE LECHE" bakery for breakfast and lunch.
For anyone who want fast access to Manhattan and reasonable dwelling price, this is idea place to stay.

neighborhood_overview:
Scenic Views: The Heights is known for its stunning panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Many homes and streets offer breathtaking vistas of the city, especially from the higher elevations.

Parks and Green Spaces: The Heights is home to several parks and green spaces, providing residents with recreational opportunities. Riverview-Fisk Park, in particular, is a popular spot for picnics, outdoor events, and enjoying the views.

Local Businesses: The Heights has a growing number of small businesses, including restaurants, cafes, boutiques, and galleries. Residents can find a variety of dining options, from traditional to international cuisine.

Arts and Culture: The Heights has a burgeoning arts and cultural scene, with local artists and musicians contributing to the creative energy of the neighborhood. Art galleries and music venues often host events and exhibitions.

name: Quiet 2 bdr apt, 12 min from NYC
description: Experience historic charm in this 2-bed, 2-bath garden-level apartment in Paulus Hook, Jersey City. Just 6 min ferry ride to Manhattan, easy access to main tourist attractions and public transportation and walking distance from local restaurants and entertainment. Fully renovated, quiet, and equipped with modern amenities like washer/dryer, radiant heat, and central A/C. Your ideal home away from home.
view: Quiet 2 bdr apt, 12 min from NYCExperience historic charm in this 2-bed, 2-bath garden-level apartment in Paulus Hook, Jersey City. Just 6 min ferry ride to Manhattan, easy access to main tourist attractions and public transportation and walking distance from local restaurants and entertainment. Fully renovated, quiet, and equipped with modern amenities like washer/dryer, radiant heat, and central A/C. Your ideal home away from home.
neighborhood_overview:
Our home provides seamless access to NYC with multiple transportation options, including ferry, bus, PATH, and light rail. Two PATH stations are less than 10 minutes away for a quick 10-minute ride to Lower Manhattan, and the same goes for the ferry. Enjoy a picturesque view of the World Trade Tower and NYC's Skyline from our street. While we're close to NYC, our neighborhood offers peace and quiet, along with easy access to charming coffee shops and restaurants. We're also just a 15-minute drive from EWR without traffic.

Street parking is generally hassle-free, with visitor permits required Mon. - Fri. No parking on Thursdays (1pm - 3pm) for street cleaning, but no permits are needed on weekends/holidays. We can provide visitor digital permits for $10/day, with no personal information required, only your car's details.

neighborhood_overview:
NOTABLE & UNIQUE NEIGHBORHOOD CHARACTERISTICS
The way a neighborhood looks and feels when you walk or drive around it, from its setting, its buildings, and its flavor, can make all the difference. This neighborhood has some really cool things about the way it looks and feels as revealed by Neighborhood Scout's exclusive research. This might include anything from the housing stock to the types of households living here to how people get around.

Modes of Transportation
More people ride the bus in this neighborhood each day to get to work than 98.9% of U.S. neighborhoods.

Also, in the West Bergen neighborhood, 19.1% of people ride the train to work each day. This is a very high percentage compared to most places. In fact, NeighborhoodScout's analysis reveals that this is a higher level of train ridership than in 96.9% of the neighborhoods in America.

name: Spacious Parisian Inspired 1BR Just 15 Mins to NYC
description:
Meet your NYC Getaway!

Welcome to this French-inspired, spacious and comfortable charming 1 BR/1BA in the heart of vibrant Jersey City.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Journal Square, an exciting and bustling neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey. This area is a perfect blend of old and new, with modern architecture and historic brick buildings coexisting seamlessly. The energy here is contagious, but at the same time calmer than downtown areas.

At the heart of the neighborhood, the intersection of John F. Kennedy Boulevard and Newark Avenue is abuzz with activity. There is an endless variety of restaurants, shops, and other businesses to explore, and the residents love the lively atmosphere.

One of the cultural gems of the neighborhood is the renowned Mana Contemporary Art Center. This awe-inspiring center is housed in a renovated old brick industrial building and offers exciting contemporary art exhibits and shows.

neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

Nestled in Jersey City's heart, our Airbnb blends city allure with cozy tranquility. Step into a lively area brimming with diverse restaurants, cafes, and local shops, offering a taste of Jersey City's cultural tapestry.

Perfect Urban Hub:

Welcome to Our Vibrant Jersey City Neighborhood!

Discover Urban Comfort & Excitement:

Nestled in Jersey City's heart, our Airbnb blends city allure with cozy tranquility. Step into a lively area brimming with diverse restaurants, cafes, and local shops, offering a taste of Jersey City's cultural tapestry.

Perfect Urban Hub:

Our central spot ensures you're always at the heart of the action. Delight in diverse cuisines at nearby eateries, explore local art scenes, or savor leisurely walks through scenic parks.

Gateway to Adventures:

Just a 15 minute drive to downtown Manhattan, dive into iconic landmarks and Broadway shows. Retreat to our peaceful neighborhood after a day's city immersion.

Large kitchen fully stocked. Tons of great restaurants, grocery stores, and laundromat within walking distance. Short walk to West Side Avenue Light Rail. 5 minute walk to the huge gorgeous Lincoln Park with walking trails, basketball, tennis, soccer field, running track, and kayaking.

Welcome to Our Vibrant Jersey City Neighborhood!

Discover Urban Comfort & Excitement:

Nestled in Jersey City's heart, our Airbnb blends city allure with cozy tranquility. Step into a lively area brimming with diverse restaurants, cafes, and local shops, offering a taste of Jersey City's cultural tapestry.

Perfect Urban Hub:

Our central spot ensures you're always at the heart of the action. Delight in diverse cuisines at nearby eateries, explore local art scenes, or savor leisurely walks through scenic parks.

Gateway to Adventures:

Just 20 minutes from Manhattan, dive into iconic landmarks and Broadway shows. Retreat to our peaceful neighborhood after a day's city immersion.

Nearby Gems:

Only 15 minutes away lies the American Dream Mall, a haven for shopping, dining, and entertainment galoreâ€”all under one roof.

name: Ocean Blues Studio - 25 mins to NYC
description:
Enjoy a unique and stylish stay in this recently gut renovated garden level studio apartment in Bergen-Lafayette with a private courtyard. The centrally-located apartment is 25 mins from downtown NYC, a few mins walk to Berry Lane Park (Tony Hawk Skate Park) and Arlington Park.

Enjoy access to the studio apartment and courtyard with separate private entrance, private spa-like bathroom and living/dining area with a full refrigerator and breakfast/coffee bar. The pictures speak for themselves!

The centrally-located apartment is 25 mins from downtown NYC, a few mins walk to Berry Lane Park (Tony Hawk Skate Park) and Arlington Park.

Enjoy access to the studio apartment and courtyard with separate private entrance, private spa-like bathroom and living/dining area with a full refrigerator and breakfast/coffee bar. The pictures speak for themselves!
neighborhood_overview: Bergen-Lafayette is an area of Jersey City thatâ€™s considered a hidden gem and is quickly gaining popularity as the new hot spot. Bergen-Lafayette (Bela for short) is made up of different neighborhoods and lies west-southwest of Downtown and Liberty State Park. Like most areas in the city, this neighborhood is popping up with lots of shops, restaurants, bars, and new places to explore.

name: Bright, Airy Studio Apt in Amenity Building
description: Get the best sunset views on the east coast from our sweet studio in the sky. Our gorgeous, open plan studio looks west from the 61st floor of Jersey City Urby, an icon on the Jersey City Skyline. Enjoy a peaceful nights sleep and a fabulous view while you work from home. This apartment has a full kitchen, an oversized walk in shower, massive windows and a cozy living space.
view: Bright, Airy Studio Apt in Amenity BuildingGet the best sunset views on the east coast from our sweet studio in the sky. Our gorgeous, open plan studio looks west from the 61st floor of Jersey City Urby, an icon on the Jersey City Skyline. Enjoy a peaceful nights sleep and a fabulous view while you work from home. This apartment has a full kitchen, an oversized walk in shower, massive windows and a cozy living space.
neighborhood_overview: While you may be tempted to spend all of your time exploring our gorgeous building, don't sleep on all of the offerings Jersey City has to offer! Hop downstairs to DomoDomo for some Michelin-rated Japanese bites, or walk on over to Departed Soles Brewing Company to try a flight of local beers. Take advantage of your proximity to Liberty State Park, and explore gorgeous views of New York Harbor and Lady Liberty herself, and while you're over there check out some of our world-class museums, like Ellis Island or Liberty Science Center.

description: This beautiful apartment features condo-grade appliances, high ceilings, private rooftop with views of NYC, plus a dedicated lobby for secure entry. Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:
- Upscale furnishings, tall ceilings, and gourmet kitchens in every unit

Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and Fifth Avenue, this Downtown Jersey City building is a better value than anything youâ€™d find across the Hudson - and you can still get to NYC in minutes via the ferry or the PATH train.

Rest and relax in this peaceful oasis perched on the edge of the river, which features plush mattresses, sophisticated wood furnishings, and spacious closets so you can unpack and stay for a while. In the bathroom, youâ€™ll find masterful tile work and modern fixtures - plus towels and toiletries provided for your convenience.

name: Studio Inn Ycee
description:
Located in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.
The bedroom loft has a 5'6 height clearance. With a queen-sized bed, and storage for clothes. Downstairs are the communal spaces, living room, and TV area with couches, seating, and tables.

I occasionally use the space for photo and video shoots, but I am more than happy to share it with others. Since I travel frequently, you may have the place to yourself for several days or even weeks at a time.

Please feel free to send me a message!

neighborhood_overview:
Bergen Lafayette is a diverse and historic neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey. It's situated in the southern part of Jersey City and is known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and community-oriented atmosphere. Here are some key aspects of the Bergen Lafayette neighborhood:

1. **Historical Significance:** Bergen Lafayette has a deep historical background. It was initially a part of the old city of Bergen and has a legacy dating back to the 17th century. The area has seen significant changes over time, witnessing industrial growth and subsequent decline, followed by periods of revitalization and community-driven initiatives.

2. **Diversity:** The neighborhood is home to a diverse population, comprising various ethnicities, cultures, and socio-economic backgrounds. This diversity is reflected in its residents, local businesses, and community events.

3. **Residential Character:** Bergen Lafayette offers a mix of residential housing option

neighborhood_overview:
Bergen Lafayette is a diverse and historic neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey. It's situated in the southern part of Jersey City and is known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and community-oriented atmosphere. Here are some key aspects of the Bergen Lafayette neighborhood:

1. **Historical Significance:** Bergen Lafayette has a deep historical background. It was initially a part of the old city of Bergen and has a legacy dating back to the 17th century. The area has seen significant changes over time, witnessing industrial growth and subsequent decline, followed by periods of revitalization and community-driven initiatives.

2. **Diversity:** The neighborhood is home to a diverse population, comprising various ethnicities, cultures, and socio-economic backgrounds. This diversity is reflected in its residents, local businesses, and community events.

3. **Residential Character:** Bergen Lafayette offers a mix of residential housing option

name: Cute, bright and spacious room!
description:
If you are looking for a quiet, spacious, clean and fabulous room in the heart of downtown Jersey City, this is your place.
The apt is located to 8-10 min walk from Grove Path station. 8 mins to WTC or 25 mins to 34th st by train.
The apt has great views of NYC from it as well as having a rooftop and balcony. Comes with a nice sizable closet to keep your belongings safe.
The apt is a brownstone building located a few blocks from Newark Ave.
This is a walk-up building, located on the 5th floor.

Scenic Views: The Heights is known for its stunning panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Many homes and streets offer breathtaking vistas of the city, especially from the higher elevations.

Parks and Green Spaces: The Heights is home to several parks and green spaces, providing residents with recreational opportunities. Riverview-Fisk Park, in particular, is a popular spot for picnics, outdoor events, and enjoying the views.

Local Businesses: The Heights has a growing number of small businesses, including restaurants, cafes, boutiques, and galleries. Residents can find a variety of dining options, from traditional to international cuisine.

Arts and Culture: The Heights has a burgeoning arts and cultural scene, with local artists and musicians contributing to the creative energy of the neighborhood. Art galleries and music venues often host events and exhibitions.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Jersey City, just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan. Jersey Cityâ€™s bustling waterfront is so packed with office tours that it is affectionately known as â€œWall Street Westâ€ among locals. In all, more than 100,000 people are employed within the city. Jersey City is home to its own thriving international dining scene, including a number of fantastic Vietnamese restaurants and James Beard Award semifinalist Rick Eastonâ€™s Bread & Salt Bakery, where you can try some amazing Roman-style pizza. There are also plenty of shops around Journal Square and Newport Centre, a shopping mall located in nearby Newport. Jersey City has excellent public transportation, with both express and local buses and a light rail system. The entire area is well connected to Manhattan via NJ Transitâ€™s PATH train system, which runs 24/7 between several stops in Jersey City and 33rd Street and the World Trade Center in Manhattan.

Our cozy and thoughtfully designed apartment is an urban oasis, just a stone's throw away from the iconic skyline of Manhattan. view: #NAME?
neighborhood_overview:
Scenic Views: The Heights is known for its stunning panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Many homes and streets offer breathtaking vistas of the city, especially from the higher elevations.

Parks and Green Spaces: The Heights is home to several parks and green spaces, providing residents with recreational opportunities. Riverview-Fisk Park, in particular, is a popular spot for picnics, outdoor events, and enjoying the views.

Local Businesses: The Heights has a growing number of small businesses, including restaurants, cafes, boutiques, and galleries. Residents can find a variety of dining options, from traditional to international cuisine.

Arts and Culture: The Heights has a burgeoning arts and cultural scene, with local artists and musicians contributing to the creative energy of the neighborhood. Art galleries and music venues often host events and exhibitions.

name: Small room near Path,25 mins to World Trade Center
description:
Cozy room in a walk-up apartment on 3rd floor. Twin size bed. Quiet and sunny. Shared bathroom.
Restaurants and supermarkets around.
About 12 minutes walk to Path station, where you can take the Path train to the World Trade Center and Wall Street in Manhattan in 12 minutes, or to Empire State Building in 25 minutes. You can also take bus 119 downstairs to Port Authority in 30 minutes and walk to the Times Square.
No smoking or drugs or party.

description:
Come stay at this 1880's row house 2 bedroom cosy, peaceful duplex with deck and backyard.

You'll be close to the Lightrail and PATH trains which will take you right into Manhattan. Bergen-Lafayette is an up-and-coming area with new restaurants opening monthly! Very hip and quaint.


Pretty and quiet block for an urban area.

description:

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City Heights is a diverse and bustling neighborhood perched at the top of the palisades cliff behind Hoboken, with sweeping NYC views providing a perfect mix of city and space. Beautiful, tree filled parks dot the neighborhood that is otherwise full of incredible restaurants, cafes and bars. Easy access to NYC via bus, light rail connections to PATH train and NY Waterway Ferry. Explore the vibrant art scene of Downtown JC or the charm of Hoboken just down the hill.

Bergen Lafayette is a diverse and historic neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey. It's situated in the southern part of Jersey City and is known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and community-oriented atmosphere. Here are some key aspects of the Bergen Lafayette neighborhood:

1. **Historical Significance:** Bergen Lafayette has a deep historical background. It was initially a part of the old city of Bergen and has a legacy dating back to the 17th century. The area has seen significant changes over time, witnessing industrial growth and subsequent decline, followed by periods of revitalization and community-driven initiatives.

2. **Diversity:** The neighborhood is home to a diverse population, comprising various ethnicities, cultures, and socio-economic backgrounds. This diversity is reflected in its residents, local businesses, and community events.

3. **Residential Character:** Bergen Lafayette offers a mix of residential housing option

The neighborhood is a collection of beautiful old homes on a trafficked but tree-lined street.
The house is just a block away from the Washington park and 5 min walk from Riverview Park where you can enjoy yoga in the park, farmer's market on Saturday, great coffee shops such as Modcup, and speakeasy Fox and Crow are just a block away.

Elevator to Hoboken - a great spot for fine dining and bars hopping, as well as Shoprite and Trader's Joe is just a few minute walk away!

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights, often referred to simply as "The Heights," is a vibrant neighborhood in Jersey City, New Jersey. Perched atop the New Jersey Palisades, it offers stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River.

Originally an independent municipality known as Hudson City, it merged with Jersey City in 1869. The area is known for its stately Victorian and Edwardian homes, particularly along Summit Avenue and Sherman Place. Pershing Field Park, located in the center of the district, offers green spaces, baseball fields, and other recreation amenities. The adjacent Jersey City Reservoir No. 3 is a designated wetland and park.

Central Avenue serves as the main shopping district with over 240 businesses, contributing to the neighborhood's small-town feel.

The area is well-connected with various transportation options, including the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail, which makes commuting to Manhattan convenient.

name: Fresh 2 bed 1 bath apt parking W/D, 20 min to NYC!
description:
28 + day rental only!
This renovated apartment in Jersey City Height NJ, across river from Manhattan has everything you need!

3rd floor apartment, lots of natural light, safe neighborhood, equipped with granite counter tops, dishwasher, TV, wifi.

Walk to local bars, restaurants and supermarkets, go to Hoboken on foot, or go to NYC!

With light rail within 4 min walk from the place, buses to NYC within 1 block, how can you resist to live your best city life in JC?

neighborhood_overview:
13 minutes walking distance to ShopRite. 1 block from Congress St where you can take an elevator to Hoboken - a great spot for fine dining and bars hopping.

The neighborhood is a collection of beautiful old homes on a trafficked but tree-lined street. The house is half a block from Riverview Park where you can enjoy yoga in the park, farmer's market on Saturday, great coffee shops such as Modcup, and speakeasy Fox and Crow are just a block away.

neighborhood_overview:
Brimming with historic charm, cute local boutiques, coffee shops and restaurants stretched along walkable, tree-shaded streets, Hamilton Park historic district contains buildings dating as far back as the Civil War, and many of its homes are historic brick row houses and brownstones with wide, sweeping front steps leading to wooden doors with intricately carved detailing curving over doors, windows and along rooflines.

One of the key reasons residents adore Hamilton Park is the abundance of amenities it offers. The centerpiece of the area, Hamilton Park, provides a lush green space where you can enjoy picnics, play sports, or simply relax under the shade of majestic trees. In addition to the park, Pavonia Avenue hosts a diverse array of restaurants, cafes, and shops, catering to various tastes and interests. From trendy brunch spots to charming boutiques, there is no shortage of things to do and explore in this vibrant neighborhood.

neighborhood_overview: "Bergen-Lafayette in Jersey City is a neighborhood brimming with history, culture, and charm. Located just south of Downtown Jersey City, this vibrant area offers a mix of residential streets, parks, and local businesses. Explore its rich architectural heritage, with historic brownstones and industrial buildings adding character to the streetscape. Discover a diverse culinary scene, with restaurants serving up everything from classic comfort food to international cuisine. Enjoy outdoor recreation at nearby parks like Berry Lane Park, or take a leisurely stroll along the waterfront with stunning views of the Manhattan skyline. With its blend of old-world charm and modern amenities, Bergen-Lafayette is a neighborhood worth exploring."
